characters: SNARLING MONSTER HEADS, LON WITHERED ARMS, EVISCERATED
LIGHTS BLINDING INTO LENS. CAMERA TIPS DOWN TO REVEAL
CUT TO A CAMERA AND DOLLY
SEEING HER RUNNING ACROSS THE STREET
CUT TO WHAT SHE'S LOOKING AT
HOLDS ON HIM A BEAT, THEN MOVES UP AND INTO THE BACK OF T

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DEEP, GRIM MUSIC in ULTRA-STEREO, SUPERSATURATED COLORS,  CAMERA MOVES SLICK AND OMINOUS, as we BEGIN A SERIES OF C

dialogues.speaker: SHOTS OF GRIMY HANDS. BUILDING --
dialogues.text: A STEEL HAND, shining dully in the dark shadows of a filt boiler room - being assembled slowly over -- METAL FINGERS -- COMPOSITE SINEW -- the SPARK of hammer o metal -- then -- the thing suddenly flexes as if alive -- CLOSE ON REMOTE CONTROL DEVICE -- clean hands manipulatin levers -- THE STEEL HAND -- forms into a heavy fist -- thumps on ta - then the GRIMY HANDS of the CREATOR thrust in again --  begin affixing long, shining blades to the end of the ste fingers -- CLOSER ON BLADES -- gleaming, dangerously long. CUTAWAYS TO FURNACES -- belching FIRE and SMOKE. STEAM PIPES -- hissing and dripping into endless depths o this hellish place. THE HAND -- fitted with the final claw -- now a super-mod almost futuristic version of Freddy's glove -- flexing an trembling. THE MAKER'S RIGHT HAND -- caresses it -- then retracts an lays itself on the filthy work bench -- the MAKER'S LEFT ENTERS FRAME WITH A HUGE CLEAVER and raises it over the w of the right hand -- then strikes down hard!

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO A CAMERA AND DOLLY
dialogues.text: SHADOWY CREW GASPS -- we hear a muffled EEUWWW --  THE STUMP OF THE MAKER'S RIGHT ARM -- now spurting blood raises --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More blood, more blood! Nearby, CHUCK and TERRY, two young SPFX assistants, pump blood through tubing, using large plastic syringes.  It's messy job, they're covered with fake blood themselves, as their boss, CHASE PORTER, good-looking, early 30's, tweak the levers of a remote control device. BEHIND THEM, at the edge of the set, Chase's wife, HEATHE LANGENKAMP, 30, dressed in woman's pajamas, and his son  DYLAN, 5, watch from their chairs.  Heather, appalled by scene's violence, puts her hand over Dylan's startled eye THE STUMP OF THE MAKER'S ARM thrusts now into the cuff of steel hand, synthetic tendons snake out of the steel hand bury themselves in the maker's wrists, and the unseen act flexes the razor-sharp steel blades, wheels and SLASHES I CAMERA as we hear VOICE (cont'd) (O.S.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CUT!  Fantastic! BUZZER.  THE FURNACES STOP BELCHING FIRE.  SMOKE, STEAM a WATER stop dead.  Instead there's CHATTER, LIGHTS and  movement as the crew bustles in to reset for the next tak The director, WES CRAVEN, rushes over to Chase ad thumps on the back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chase, you're a genius!  This makes his  old claw look like Mother Theresa's! Chase waves a 'them too' hand towards his assistants. CRAVEN (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You, too, Terry, Chuck.  Great blood! CHUCK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. TERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's some of our best work. Laughter.  Craven cracks a bottle of Lipovitan.  Chuck wa by with dripping steel hand as Chase rumples Dylan's hair CHASE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Want to see some neat stuff? Dylan looks up wide-eyed. HEATHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chase, no. Chase laughs. CHASE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, it's only make believe!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And lifts Dylan, leading Heather away.  STEADICAM WITH TH as they move off-set through crew and equipment into a wo area behind the boiler room flats. He sets Dylan on a workbench.  The kid's surrounded by

dialogues.speaker: SNARLING MONSTER HEADS, LON WITHERED ARMS, EVISCERATED
dialogues.text: TORSOS, propped in corners and peering off temporary shel The handiwork of Chase's SPFX MAKEUP wizardry. CHASE (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You hungry, Dylan? He give Dylan a large Chinese food takeout container.  Dy opens it and a reptilian head jumps out.  Dylan gives a s as Chase laughs. CHASE (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gotcha! HEATHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chase! Chase takes it back from Dylan.  Shows it's only a hand  puppet.  Meanwhile Chuck's brought the claw back from the and placed it on a work armature. CHUCK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It should have flexed more.  I think the  servos got shorted out with blood. CHASE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Insulate 'em with some styro.  It wasn't  designed to be submerged, for Petesakes. Heather looks at it eerily. HEATHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't like that thing. He turns, a funny gleam in his eye. CHASE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This thing puts bread on our table. DYLAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it alive, Daddy? A.D. (O.S.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heather, you're in the next shot! Heather turns, a little confused. CHASE (putting Dylan on again)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Might as well be, Dylan.  State of the  art animatronics enhanced with bio- organic grafting.  Bull tendons, nerve  bundles from a Doberman, even half the  brain of a homicidal primate was... HEATHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chase... heather is looking at the hand again, but now her express is growing more alarmed. Chase looks over, reacts to

dialogues.speaker: THE HAND
dialogues.text: flexing.  Trembling. CHASE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey... Chase reaches out to steady the hand, but with incredible speed it contorts.  The claws flick and Chase reels back a cry, staring at his own bloody fingers. CHASE (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit! Chase grabs the remote and switches it off.  THE CLAW fal still.  The other assistant, CHUCK, peers down at it in  curiosity. CHUCK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Must've picked up something from an AD's  walkie-talkie... He flops it over with a screwdriver and pokes at it.  The hand lets out a LITTLE SOUND, half machine, half animal. Terry puts his hand near it, palm down, then looks at Cha TERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sure it's turned off? CHASE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's off. TERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Funny.  It's warm.  Like a real hand. Chuck leans down and peers more closely at it.  Goes to p it again.  But before his finger touches it the clawed st hand leaps up and glues itself to his neck.  Its gleaming talons sinking into his throat! Chuck jerks back.  Clawing the thing away.  Clutching his throat as blood spurts from between his fingers.

dialogues.speaker: THE HAND
dialogues.text: smacks back on the table and scrambles out of sight with clatter of steel.  Into the warren of tools and equipment Fast as some spiny creature from a thousand fathoms! Heather screams.  Dylan draws back, pale and frightened a Chase grabs the remote controller and smashes it.  Pulls the batteries and flings them away.  Every furnace in the place suddenly ROARS BACK TO LIFE! CRAVEN (O.S.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell's going on?!  Kill the  effects! FIRE, SMOKE AND STEAM HOWLING as Chuck crashes blindly in Chase and both go down.  Terry claws cursing through the  jumble atop the toolbench, trying to find where the damn  thing went. ANGLE ON THE FLOOR - THE CLAW skitters down on one leg of bench fast as a wharf rat and attacks Terry's foot, slici through his Achilles tendon! TERRY shrieks and falls hard, and the instant he slams in the floor, the claw drives straight into his heart!  Terr screams as the claw wheels and scrambles straight for the sprawl of Chase and Chuck's convulsing body!

dialogues.speaker: CU CHASE
dialogues.text: reacting in horror. CHASE'S POV TO CHUCK'S BODY as the CLAW APPEARS over the of Chuck's shoulder, inches from Chase's face, spreading talons wide! CHASE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heather!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heather convulses in bed.  Terror elevated by... CHASE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heather!! Earthquake!! Chase's already half out of bed, clawing at her. CHASE (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get in the doorway DYLAN (O.S.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mommmmeee! That voice jolts her fully awake. HEATHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dylan! A framed picture falls with a deafening crash, its glass  shattering, narrowly missing Chase.  Heather sprawls out the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HAND-HELD and rough, CAMERA grabbing the action as best i can.  Heather half runs, half braces against bucking wall while pictures and china shatter.  Chase staggering behin her into

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The child sits upright among his twisted bedclothes stari at the toys swinging wildly from his ceiling.  Then it's  over. CAMERA STABILIZES, but remains HANDHELD.  There has not b nor will there be any MUSIC CUES. The house has fallen still.  The swimming pool, seen outs the window, slaps against its walls.  There's a weird  ELECTRONIC ULULATION outside, up and down the street, lik spaceships landing.  Heather looks at Chase. CHASE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Car alarms.  You okay? She nods, scrambles up and lifts Dylan, who's begun to cr Hugs him.  He's full of jagged energy, soaked with sweat. CHASE (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You okay, chief? DYLAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: no. HEATHER (feels his forehead)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have a fever, sweetie? Dylan shakes his head.  Heather kisses him. CHASE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just an earthquake, Dylan.  Every once in  a while we get a few. HEATHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No biggie, really. Chase rumples the kid's hair.  Then Dylan says solemnly. DYLAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daddy, blood. Heather follows Dylan's eyes to Chase, to his bloody hand Chase notices with a start, grabbing one of Dylan's T-shi and wrapping it, saying a bit too quickly. CHASE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing, guys, just a scratch. But it's already been dripping through the cotton. HEATHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where'd you...get that? Chase shrugs. CHASE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The picture, I guess.  When it fell.   It's nothing, really. He gives her a look, like 'cool it in front of the kid, a least', and turns. CHASE (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll put a bandage on it.  Don't worry  about it. And he goes out.  Heather looks at Dylan and he looks at It's hard to say which is more frightened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heather, keeping to herself, tries to make order from the mess in the cabinets.  Chase, hand bandaged, brooms broke crockery until the kettle whistles, then abandons the cle to make instant coffee. HEATHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One of mom's cups got broken. CHASE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry.  At least we're in on piece. She says nothing.  In the living room, the TV NEWSCASTER  drones on about the morning's 5.5 quake, ('...latest of w Seismologists are calling a swarm'). HEATHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do we have to watch that? Chase, washing down a fast piece of toast, yawns and blin CHASE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought you turned it on. He zaps it off.  Heather eyes him, then turns on Dylan wh making a face in his oatmeal.  Scary eyes.  Gape of mouth HEATHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dylan, it's breakfast.  Not arts and  crafts (feels Chase watching)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? CHASE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You get any sleep last night? HEATHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More or less. (swipes hair from eyes)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dylan, time to get dressed.  I'm late. DYLAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You going away? HEATHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just for a few hours.  Julie'll be with  you. He sighs, then goes into his room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two dress, Heather rather smartly.  Chase, in jeans a sweatshirt, is packing a small overnighter.  Chase again  notes Heather's withdrawal. CHASE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anything other than the obvious bothering  you? HEATHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Five earthquakes in three weeks is  enough. CHASE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hasn't been another call, has there? She shakes her head.  Chase looks relieved. CHASE (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two full weeks without him.  Maybe he got  run over by a truck. Heather doesn't seem to take any comfort in this. HEATHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He feels closer, if anything. (low)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's giving me nightmares. He looks at her more closely. CHASE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have one last night? She finally nods yes.  He softens his voice. CHASE (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's just a reaction to the earthquake,  Heather. HEATHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or maybe I shouldn't do this interview  today. CHASE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've got to get back on the horse some  time. (off her look)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, you've had a nutcase making  harassing phone calls.  I know how scary  that feels. HEATHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, you don't. CHASE (kind)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, but it still doesn't mean it can't  be over with. She turns away. HEATHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What if it isn't over? CHASE (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe you should tell me your dream. She give s shrug, like it's silly to even talk about it. HEATHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was nothing.  We were both working on  some movie, and a special effects thing  went horribly wrong.  Terry and Chuck  were...hurt.  You were almost... (at his bandaged hand)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were even cut. CHASE (uneasy)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You probably were half awake and saw me  get nicked by that picture glass.  Dreams  work like that. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want me not to go on this job? HEATHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just be careful, okay? CHASE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I should survive two days in Palmdale  supplying soap bubbles for a detergent  commercial, don't you think? HEATHER (reluctant smile)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guess so. CHASE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 48 hours.  Back before you know it. He kisses her and she kisses back, holding on a moment. he grabs his suitcase and exits.  Heather closes her eyes Hears him say goodbye to Dylan downstairs, hears the fron door close.  Then a brittle BREAKING SOUND.  Heather looks up and sees FOUR THIN CRACKS snaking down her bedroom wall.  A moment later the TV can be heard again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heather races down to find Chase, but is stopped when she sees Dylan directly in front of the TV screen, impassivel watching her.  As Nancy in NIGHTMARE I, looking in horror

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tina in the bloody bodybag standing in the doorway to Nan schoolroom. TINA (TV)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Naaancyyyy....

dialogues.speaker: CU NANCY
dialogues.text: reacting in terror. HEATHER (O.S.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dylan, I don't want you watching that.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO HEATHER
dialogues.text: as she snaps off the TV.  Then in fury pulls out the plug well.  The instant she does, the silent child lets out an piercing howl. HEATHER (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dylan, stop it!  What in the world's  gotten in to you? THE PHONE RINGS.  Dylan instantly falls silent.  Heather  looks at him.  He's eerily still now, just watching her. phone RINGS a second time and she snatches it up, still  distracted by her son's eyes. HEATHER (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello? Through a deep ROARING OF BOILERS we HEAR a strange garbl VOICE sing VOICE (FILTER)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One two... She reacts, then slams it down.  Stares at it.  That soun and the voice - deep, murderous, mocking.  A flawless  imitation of...Freddy. Scared now, she runs to the front door just in time to se

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHASE'S PICKUP TRUCK giving a honk as it drives off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HEATHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chase! But he hasn't heard her, and soon is out of sight.  Heath closes the door, turns and sees Dylan, still staring at h DYLAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Someone's coming. HEATHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? An instant later, something gives the whole house a subtl SHAKE, rattling everything in it.  Heather grabs Dylan, b there's nothing more. Then the DOORBELL rings. Heather freezes, paralyzed by unspeakable fear.  Then VOICE (O.S.) (through door)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heather? Heather opens the door to JULIE, a direct, open-faced you woman.  She blinks at Heather's pale face. JULIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everything okay? Heather nods sheepishly. HEATHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, Julie, I'm sorry.  I just  thought...there was an earthquake, I  think.  Little one, but... JULIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Big truck went right by before you opened  the door. (grins)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Life on the Fault Line. She looks past Heater.  Gives Dylan a smile. JULIE (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, tiger! She lifts him with a laugh.  Heather watches the two,  fighting a wave of vertigo. HEATHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think he has a fever?  He felt warm  to me this morning. Julie feels his forehead. JULIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seems okay. (eyes Heather)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That all that's wrong?  You seem... The telephone RINGS again.  Heather snatches it up. HEATHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leave us alone, you creep! VOICE (FILTER) (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LA Limousine, ma'am.  Just wanted you to  know I'm out front. Julie looks at her with surprise.  Heather walks to the f door and checks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A BLACK LIMO idles in the driveway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HEATHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, sorry.  Hang on a minute. HEATHER closes the door, returns to the kitchen and hangs the phone. JULIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heather, what is it? HEATHER (low)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dunno.  Just have this feeling today... She bites her lip, then Dylan speaks, soberly, quietly. DYLAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mommy stay home, then. He turns and walks into his room.  Julie looks at Heather JULIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He'll be fine, don't worry. She goes in the bedroom after Dylan.  Heater takes a long breath...then grabs the phone and dials. MAN'S VOICE (FILTER)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Studio B. HEATHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi.  This is Heather Langenkamp. MAN'S VOICE (FILTER)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The car's no there yet? HEATHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  I...listen, I can't make it in  today. MAN'S VOICE (FILTER) (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're kidding, right? Heather shakes her head. HEATHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, I can't. MAN'S VOICE (FILTER)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, dammit. HEATHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just can't. She hangs up.  Starts for Dylan's room, then the PHONE RI Heather comes back and picks it up, fully expecting it to the studio and dreading it. HEATHER (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes? She reacts, realizing too late she's listening to the HIS STEAM. VOICE (FILTER)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One two... She slams the phone down.  Stares at the thing like it wa snake.  It RINGS AGAIN.  She hesitates.  Picks it up fina Holds it at a distance for a moment.  Then puts it to her ear. HEATHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello? VOICE (FILTER)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Freddy's coming for yooooouuuu. She recoils and slams it down!  Turns and kicks a chair. CRASH!  Senses someone behind her and whirls to see Julie standing in Dylan's doorway. JULIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it, Heather? Heather blinks. HEATHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn caller. Julie crosses to her, lowering her voice so Dylan can't h JULIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's started again? Heather just nods. JULIE (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sick bastard (puts her hand over her mouth)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry. (brighter)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dylan.  He doesn't have a fever like you  thought.  Probably just your nerves. Heather gives her a funny look. HEATHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nerves? Julie blushes. JULIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just meant form the shaker this  morning.  I mean, everyone's freaked out  at how many we've been having.  Then the  calls. Heather starts to say something, then the PHONE RINGS aga She snatches it up and shouts. HEATHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop calling me, you sonuvabitch! VOICE #2 (FILTER) (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You talk to your agent this way? (Heather blanches)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you try to cancel an appearance on  AM/LA at the last damn minute.  What the  hell's with you? Heather sags in dismay. HEATHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, Jerry.  I just...can't leave  the house right now. JERRY (FILTER)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What, you wanna single-handedly bury your  career?!  Lose your house, put your  husband and kid out on the street?  Or  just give your old agent a heart attack? Heather slumps. HEATHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, fine, I'll be there.  It's just,  the calls started again. Jerry switches to his commiserative voice. JERRY (FILTER)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unfortunately, this kinda crap is part of  the business these days, Heather.  Have  you thought of buying a good handgun? HEATHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got a five-year old in the house,  Jerry! JERRY (FILTER)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's an L.A. kid, probably already has  one. (laughs)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Call me after the interview, okay? And he hangs up.  Heather looks, sees Dylan staring at he from his doorway. HEATHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dylan, I gotta go.  Forgive me? DYLAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bye. She crosses and gives him a big hug.  We see his face ove her shoulder.  Lost.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heather and Julie exit an attractive house in an affluent neighborhood. JULIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll call the cops for you.  You've got  the number on the fridge, right? HEATHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks.  Just give them the time he  called.  They're keeping a list,  supposedly. (gives a hug)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry.  My nerves are so raw these days. JULIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'S okay. Julie gives a wave as Heather heads down the walk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: now eyeing the dark car in the drive, slowing as she sees The DRIVER, waiting, holding the back door.  A big man, f away, head distinctively bald.  It could almost be...Fred He turns.  It's just a driver, pale-faced and antsy.  Hea gets in.

dialogues.speaker: HEATER
dialogues.text: staring out the window, lost in thought.

dialogues.speaker: THE DRIVER
dialogues.text: studies her intently in his mirror. DRIVER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You played that girl...in that  movie...with the guy with the (claws his hand; Heather gives  an uneasy smile)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, sure, that's you. (smiles darkly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what I love about this job, I get  to meet the stars. HEATHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm hardly a star. DRIVER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You kidding?  I love your stuff.  First  was the best.  Where your girl friend's  cut open and dragged across the ceiling?   Awesome! (missing Heather's flinch)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And when all that blood comes out of your  boyfriend's bed?  Thought I'd shi... Heather finds the switch for the window between them.  He gives a nasty look as the gap closes. DRIVER (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But they should never've killed off  Freddy! Heather sinks back into the leather.  A moment later the lurches to a stop and her door is jerked open.  A YOUNG M leans in and grabs her arm. P.A.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heather?  We're gonna have to run!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And he nearly yanks her out of the car.

dialogues.speaker: LIGHTS BLINDING INTO LENS. CAMERA TIPS DOWN TO REVEAL
dialogues.text: HEATHER and a smiling TALKSHOW HOST. HOST

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, Heather, we're coming up on the 10th  anniversary of the first Nightmare on Elm  Street.  It's five sequels later.  Tell  us how this amazing series has affected  your life personally. Heather strains for a smile.  Shrugs. HEATHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know if it has, really.  With the  exception of One and Three, I've pretty  much kept out of it.  I'm working in  television now.  The hours let me spend  more time with my husband and little boy. HOST

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now that you have a child, is it possible  you've decided horror is bad for  children? HEATHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, not really.  I... HOST

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you let your child watch your movies? HEATHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My child?  No...but... The host cocks his head. HOST

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about another sequel?  Is Freddy  really dead? Heather twitches, responding a little too quickly. HEATHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course he is. (then, softer)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Freddy's dead and gone. HOST (setting it up)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And how about your co-star in NIGHTMARE  I.  Would you trust him alone with your  child? HEATHER (a little lost now)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robert?  I... HOST (big smile)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe we should ask him, hmmm?  We've got  a surprised, Heather.  A great big  surprise for you and our audience. A discernible rustle goes through the place.  Heather smi gamely.  Not knowing what the hell they're pulling.  The stands and yells. HOST (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ladies and gentlemen, put your hands  together for the best of the bad.  Ro- bert Ennn-gluuuuund!!!! And ROBERT ENGLUND strolls out with a good-natured wave i full Freddy MAKE-UP!  His fans erupt with thunderous appl and cheers.  After deafening WHISTLES the boys (many dres in Freddy customs, complete with plastic claws) settle in chant of FRED-DY!  FRED-DY!  FRED-DY! Englund stalks into the spotlight, hooks his claw through air and growls. ROBERT ENGLUND

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're all my children now! The place goes wild.

dialogues.speaker: HOLD ON HEATHER
dialogues.text: looking at that red and green back cavorting against the  blinding light.  The steel claws waving and poking as Eng milks it for all it's worth, reminded of a nightmare she' much rather forget.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heather gathers her things.  In an adjoining room, Robert stands in the doorway to the outside, casually elegant no civilian, signing autographs for a throng of kids.  He  glances at her out of the corner of his eye, sensing her  mood. ROBERT ENGLUND

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You okay? HEATHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm fine. ROBERT ENGLUND

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everything went great, I thought.  We  really got you, didn't we? HEATHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know why you didn't tell me,  that's all. He waves off the last of the kids and closes his outside  door, crossing into her room and exiting with her.  CAMER FOLLOWS as they walk, KIDS blockaded BG by STUDIO SECURIT heading away. ROBERT ENGLUND

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, they loved the expression on your  face.  I think they'd love to see us  together again! Heather glances back at the kids yelling after him. HEATHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In what, a romantic comedy? ROBERT ENGLUND (devilish)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just because it's a love story doesn't  mean it can't have a decapitation or two. The P.A. reappears with a cellular phone. MAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heather?  Call for you! Heather looks at the phone.  Puts it to her ear. HEATHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes? SARA (O.S.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heather, this is Sara Risher over at New  Line.  How are you? HEATHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, hi.  I'm fine, Sara.  My God, a voice  from the past! SARA (FILTER)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really!  Listen, Heather, I won't take  but a minute of your time.  It's just  that we have something to propose to you,  and wonder if you'd stop by the offices.   Bob'd love to talk to you. HEATHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh...sure...when? SARA (FILTER)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No time like the present.  The car will  bring you. HEATHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now? SARA (FILTER)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just take a minute.  You'll be glad you  did, I bet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heather exits the limo and starts in to a MODERN OFFICE  BUILDING with a SIGN reading NEW LINE CINEMA.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A sprawling space with a maze of buff-colored file cases  defining dozens of work spaces populated by smart-looking twenty-something people.  Heather stops at the machined-s front desk.  A RECEPTIONIST with dark purple lipstick and Martins peers up. RECEPTIONIST

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Help you? HEATHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm here to see Bob Shaye. The receptionist checks her out causally. RECEPTIONIST

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Was Bob expecting you? VOICE (O.S.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heather! Heather turns as SARA RISHER crosses to give her a matern hug. SARA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bob's dying to see you. WIDER.  MOVING WITH THEM as Sara leads Heather farther ba into the place grabbing a young man by the elbow. SARA (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heather this is Mike De Luca.  Mike,  Heather Langenkamp, our little Nancy's  come back home! MIKE DE LUCA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, I'm a fan!  Great meeting you. He ducks into someone else's office, giving a hi-five and closing the door.  Sara smiles at Heather. SARA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I get you something to drink? HEATHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coffee'd be nice. SARA (to the nearest)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sounds good.  Kim, would you get Heather  and me a coffee?  How you like it, Hon? HEATHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Black's fine. SARA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me too. They've reached a huge stainless steel door.  Sara raps t and pushes it open, gesturing Heather inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heather finds herself in a bright post-industrial workspa There's an unadorned desk and behind, a Warhol of Freddy  times four.  Double doors are thrown open to the terrace, out there, cordless telephone pressed to his ear, is BOB  SHAYE.  He gives a wave and starts inside. BOB (into phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gotta go.  Call me when you get to Milan.   And don't forget risotto con tarfutti.   Fantastico!  Have fun. He tosses it down and gives Heather a two-handed shake. BOB (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great seeing you, Heather - how're  things? HEATHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine.  I don't have to ask how you're  doing. He shrugs, admitting. BOB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So far so good.  Maybe we can send a  little your way, too, if you're up for  it. He gestures to an area of Italian leather and gleaming gl and sits as the assistant brings coffee.  There are two c and he immediately drinks from one, watching her gulp her then BOB (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll cut to the chase, Heather.  You  interested in making the definitive  Nightmare with us? Heather lowers her cup, taken off-guard. HEATHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought you'd killed Freddy off. BOB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We did.  Bad mistake.  The fans are  clamoring for more. So, Evil never dies,  right? (grins shakily)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anyway, a while back we got a call from  Wes.  He's got this idea.  And who better  to resurrect Freddy than his creator? HEATHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought he'd stopped doing horror. BOB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Believe it or not, he told me I hadn't  heard from him in ten years because he  hasn't had any good nightmare.  They're  his inspiration.  But now he's got a new  script in the works. She notes Bob biting his thumbnail. HEATHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which means he's having nightmares again? BOB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's very excited about it. HEATHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The nightmares. BOB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's excited about the script.  You  should be too.  It stars you. HEATHER (reacts)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I read it? BOB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's not showing it until it's down.  But  it sounds hot, and we wanted to get all  our stars lined up in case it is.  You  and Robert got great ratings today.   Which is the first thing we needed to  know. HEATHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean that was a... BOB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sort of a trial balloon. Heather blinks. HEATHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know, Bob.  I'm flattered and  all, but I've got a kid, now. BOB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So? HEATHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So I don't know about horror. BOB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on.  Kids love horror. HEATHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I...I've got other things happening. BOB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sure we can match any offer. She stands. HEATHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not that.  I've got a fan. He gets up too. BOB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sweetie, you've got lots of fans, we've  done market studies.  You rate right up  there. (puts arm around her, guides  her to door)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've already got Chase working on a  prototype for the glove. HEATHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? BOB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know.  We asked him to keep it kind of  surprise until we talked.  Look, how  about we get in touch your agent.  You  still with Jerry? HEATHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, but... BOB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll work something out.  I'm sure  you'll be happy with it. Heather turns in the door. HEATHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bob, how long has Wes been working on  this script? BOB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.  A couple months.  Why? HEATHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And since you've been thinking of making  it.  Has anything funny happened? BOB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't follow. HEATHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like weird calls, by any chance? His phone RINGS behind him.  He makes no move to pick it The phone RINGS again. HEATHER (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or nightmares? The phone rings again. HEATHER (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't you pick up your phone, Bob? Shaye shrugs. BOB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what people get paid for around  here. An assistant picks up the phone.  Straightens. KIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Ted in New York.  He wants to know  how the glove is coming. Bob gives a nervous laugh. BOB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gotta take that.  Keep in touch. Heather nods, and says quietly. HEATHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You too, Bob. She turns and starts to go.  Then stops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: for the first time she notices everyone in the outer offi has a cup of steaming coffee on his or her desk.

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: gets the hell out of there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The limo pulls up and stops.  The driver opens the door a Heather exits and walks to the house. Halfway there she  starts to hear the SCREAMS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heather bursts in and stops cold.  From Dylan's room come terrible SCREAMING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heather runs in and finds Julie by the bed with Dylan.  T boy convulsing and screaming with terrifying intensity. rushes over and holds him, terrified.  Strange and alien  words are spilling from his mouth.  A language ripped fro another world not connected with our reality at all.  Unt suddenly it's English, and he says in a clear and  terrifyingly deep voice DYLAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never sleep again, never sleep again! Then he starts sobbing as if his heart will break.  Heath looks at Julie in shock. HEATHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's going on?  Was he watching the  movie on TV again? Julie blinks. JULIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Movie?  He hasn't been watching any TV at  all.  He was taking his nap when I heard  screaming. Julie stops, shaken herself.  Heather looks at the child. Dylan turns, catches her eye with his own, and says throu his tears. DYLAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rex saved me. HEATHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rex?  Who's Rex? Dylan pulls a stuffed dinosaur out from beneath the cover and gives it to Heather.  And it nearly falls apart in he hands, its body torn by four deep cuts, its stuffing pour out. Heather looks at Dylan. DYLAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is Rex gonna die? Heather shakes her head. HEATHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, Rex is not going to die. (to Julie)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julie, you know where the sewing stuff  is, don't you? JULIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure. (Dylan)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll do an operation, Doctor Dylan and  Doctor Julie. We'll fix him good as new. Julie takes the thing, grabs Dylan and heads to the kitch Heather glances back at Dylan's bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heather in hushed conversation with Chase.  B.G. Julie se on Rex, accompanied by a worried Dylan.  Then Chase's voi CHASE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heather? HEATHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chase. Hi...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chase, on a cellular, is in the back of his SPFX trailer  working on frothing up a tub of soap suds.  B.G., set asi in mid-construction, is something shiny and sharp.  Somet we instantly recognize as FREDDY'S NEW GLOVE. CHASE (yawning)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's up? HEATHER (FILTER)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chase, you'd better come home. CHASE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heather, I'm stuck here.  Neither Chuck  or Terry came in today.  I can't get  away! HEATHER (FILTER)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chase, it's Dylan! He stands, forgetting his emergency, holding his breath. CHASE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO KITCHEN
dialogues.text: Heather nearly crying. HEATHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's had some sort of...episode. CHASE (FILTER)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?  What kind of episode? HEATHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was just acting very strange.  He  thinks somebody's after him, Chase. It's  scary, it scared me.  He was acting  like... CHASE (FILTER)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like what? HEATHER (hardly able to say it)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like Freddy. CHASE (FILTER) (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heather, has there been another call? Heather just closes her eyes, fear suppressing an answer. Demanding another question instead. HEATHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chase.  Why didn't Chuck or Terry show  up? CHASE (FILTER)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forget those two clowns, Heather.  Answer  me, did you get another call from that  guy or not? Heather bites her lip and nods. HEATHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. CHASE (FILTER) (instantly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be there in three hours. HEATHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't speed, Chase.  It's not... He's already hung up.

dialogues.speaker: CHASE
dialogues.text: jumping off the tailgate and running for his pickup.  CAM

dialogues.speaker: TRUCK AGAIN.
dialogues.text: And the place on the workbench where the glove was is now empty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Storybook peaceful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heather sits next to the bed, one elbow on the quilt, rea from the age-old fable of Hansel and Gretel.  Dylan's  scrunched under the blankets, only his head visible.  Cal you please.  The sole light comes from the child's bedsid lamp. HEATHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "...as soon as the sun was up the witch  made Gretel fetch the wood and kindle a  fire.  'We will bake cookies first,' she  said.  'I have heated the oven and  kneaded the dough.  Crawl in and see if  the fire is blazing high enough now.'   And she pushed Gretel toward the oven.   The witch meant to shut the door and bake  her once she was inside." (makes face)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dylan, this is too violent.  I don't know  why you like these stupid old tales. DYLAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finish, please! HEATHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is going to give you nightmares. DYLAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I like this story. Heather sighs.  Picks the book back up. HEATHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "But Gretel guessed what the witch was  planning.  'I don't know how to get in,'  Gretel said.  'How am I to manage it?'  'Stupid girl!'  shouted the witch,  rushing up to the oven.  'The opening is  big enough.  See, I can fit myself.'   Then quickly Gretel came behind and  pushed with all her might.  Plunging the  wicked old woman headlong into the  flames, banging the door shut and bolting  it tight.  The witch howled..." (shakes her head)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's enough. Dylan stares off into the night. DYLAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "The witch howled like a scalded cat, but  Gretel ran away and left her there to  perish nonetheless." Heather looks at Dylan in surprise, then at the page.   EXACTLY as Dylan said, the words are there.  He turns and says the rest straight to her, eyes glittering, almost  entranced. DYLAN (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "She ran to her brother as fast as she  could and flung open the door. 'Hansel!  Hansel!' she cried.  'We are saved.  The  witch is dead!'" His face is lit with a fierce radiance. Heather licks her lips. HEATHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Time for sleep. DYLAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Say how they find their way back home. She turns out the light. HEATHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tomorrow night. DYLAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  Tonight.  It's important! Heather looks at him in the moonlight.  Wide awake, tuggi at her sleeve.  She has to laugh. HEATHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dylan, you know as well as I do, they  follow the trail of bread crumbs back to  their house. Dylan sinks back with a smile. DYLAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Then their father covered them with  kisses and they were safe." HEATHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They were safe and could sleep. She tucks him in.  Then notices something.  A bump under covers, down by Dylan's feet.  She pats it, curious. DYLAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rex. He picks a flashlight off his night stand, pokes his head under the comforter and motions for her to follow. She sm curiously and sticks her head under too. UNDER THE COMFORTER, a colorful tent.  Dylan aiming the b towards the bottom of the bed and the large stuffed T-Rex there.  Snarling in the center of the sheet, its back tur to them.  It's been sewn together again, but the body loo much worse for the wear. DYLAN (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rex keeps him from coming up. HEATHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who? DYLAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The mean old man with the claws. He points past the creature to the bottom edge of the 'te DYLAN (cont'd) (matter-of-factly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He wants to come up from down there.   While we sleep.  I keep my feet up  here... (indicates 'safe' area)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rex keeps him down there.  He's my guard. (looks at her solemnly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You should have a guard, too. Heather inexplicably feels light-headed. HEATHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dylan, there's nothing down there.   Look... She reaches past the dinosaur and lifts the blankets,  exposing the bottom edge of the bed and the floor beyond. HEATHER (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See? Dylan stares at it a long moment, then shrugs. DYLAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's different when you're gone.

dialogues.speaker: OUTSIDE THE BLANKETS AGAIN
dialogues.text: Heather tucks him in, turns off his night light. DYLAN (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On, please? HEATHER (turns it back on)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, sweetie, night, night, sleep tight. DYLAN (with her)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't let the bedbugs bite. She kisses him gently and leaves the room.  But not befor his voice catches her in the doorway. DYLAN (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daddy coming home? HEATHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's on his way. DYLAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He can follow the breadcrumbs, right? HEATHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right. She leaves, closing the door, and Dylan says quietly to t night. DYLAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It the birds don't eat them first.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As it roars down a highway cutting through a bleak desert moonscape.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chase, face marked by concern and fatigue, picks up his  mobile phone and dials.  Gets nothing but STATIC.  Swears tosses it down.  Squints his eyes against oncoming bright and shakes his head, suppressing a yawn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: the road.  White lines strobing hypnotically.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: eyes bloodshot and drooping.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: he shakes his head again.  Turns on the radio.  STATIC.   Pushes SEARCH.  One HORRIBLE BLAST OF STATIC after ANOTHE Then a distant station. NEWSCASTER (FILTER)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...tectonic nightmare...fault line  hitherto unknown seems to be spread  (STATIC) so extensive that (STATIC)...

dialogues.speaker: RADIO
dialogues.text: Chases hand punches it off. SILENCE.  Just the PLOC, PLOC of rubber over expansion  joints.

dialogues.speaker: CHASE'S EYES
dialogues.text: drooping further.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LOW ON THE TIRES.  Oh so gradually crossing the flash of  white line.  OMINOUS MUSIC creeps in.

dialogues.speaker: CHASE
dialogues.text: snapping awake again, shaking his head. The MUSIC disappe

dialogues.speaker: HIS HAND
dialogues.text: scratching his leg, rubbing sore muscles. REFOCUS TO SEAT BETWEEN HIS LEGS. Music sneaks back, and with a barely audible RIP, somethi shiny and sharp pokes up through the fabric.  Then anothe and another, bright spikes of steel.  At first just tips, then longer and longer.  Until four long claws are thrust up.  Straining to break out of the fabric.

dialogues.speaker: ON CHASE'S FACE
dialogues.text: singing somberly to himself to stay awake. CHASE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is meeee, losing myyyy religion.   Look at meee, losing myyyy... Reaches down.

dialogues.speaker: HIS HAND
dialogues.text: enters FRAME AT CROTCH LEVEL.  Rearranging things with a  quick adjustment, and the claws weave just out of the way until the hand is gone. CHASE (cont'd) (O.S.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Religion...

dialogues.speaker: CU CHASE
dialogues.text: taking deep breaths.  Rubbing his face.  Then noticing  there's a torn piece of upholstery clinging to one finger He tosses it away.  Stares blearily back to the road. And as he slides deeper and deeper towards sleep.  The cl steel hand from Heather's opening nightmare RISES INTO FR Just beneath his chin now.  By his jugular. Until Chase falls asleep.  His eyes closing for good.  He falling forward on a slack neck. Instantly the claws strike upwards, hard and jerk down  through his body.  His shirt flies open.  The claw buries itself into his crotch as CHASE'S DEAFENING SHRIEK CARRIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heather wakes up screaming!  MUSIC VANISHES.  Heather bol upright on the couch.  Staring around.  Seeing

dialogues.speaker: DYLAN
dialogues.text: watching her solemnly from the doorway near his room. DYLAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mommy scared? Heather's still half asleep and disoriented.  Tries to pu calm into her voice. HEATHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mommy's fine, Dylan.  Just had a bad  dream.  What're you doing out of bed? DYLAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rex woke me up. He was fighting. Before she can respond, the DOORBELL rings.  Heather shru off the last of the dream. Stares at the door.  Who the h at this hour? HEATHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dylan, you go back to sleep now. DYLAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not sleepy. She looks through the peep hole.  Reacts.  Turns to Dylan her voice suddenly flat. HEATHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dylan, go back to bed.  I mean it. Dylan looks at her a moment longer, then obediently goes his room.  By now Heather's shaking so hard she can hardl work the bolt on the front door. When she opens it to face TWO HIGHWAY PATROL OFFICERS. HIGHWAY PATROLMAN #1

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heather Langenkamp? HEATHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes? HIGHWAY PATROLMAN #1

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is Chase Porter your husband? HEATHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. HIGHWAY PATROLMAN #1

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm afraid there was an accident.  It  appears he fell asleep while driving,  ma'am. She reaches out, steadies herself with a hand to a wall. the first time she notices the patrol car parked in her  drive. HEATHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is he...I mean, was he hurt? HIGHWAY PATROLMAN #2

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm afraid it's worse than that, ma'am. Heather weaves in the night air.  Her voice hardly  perceptible. HEATHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is he dead? HIGHWAY PATROLMAN #2

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes ma'am. HEATHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you sure it's him?  I... HIGHWAY PATROLMAN #2

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have his effects, you can confirm from  that. He hands over a clear plastic bag with a wallet, watch an some money.  Heather doesn't even take them. HEATHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to see the body. HIGHWAY PATROLMAN #1

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, you don't, ma'am, it's not necessary. HEATHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to see for myself. And the way she says it rules out any possibility that sh will not do exactly that.

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: her feet echo on the cold marble walking down a hall line with gurneys holding bodies under sheets.  From O.S.  one direction can be heard the distant sound of a WOMAN's single, gut-deep WAIL.  Then from the other, male laughte chat and the SOUND of an ELECTRIC TOOL whizzing away at  something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heather ENTERS.  At the rear of this very large room two are eating lunch out of paper bags.  A THIRD is working a body, lifting something dark and wet onto a scale. THIRD MAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Help you? HEATHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Porter.  Chase Porter. He peers at her, a bloody rubber glove poised mid-air. THIRD MAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That a new one? One of the men eating lunch points. LUNCH EATER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Over there, third from the sink. Heather goes over, CAMERA MOVING WITH HER HAND-HELD.  The lunch-eater follows with her, wiping his hands on his apr checking the toe tag.  A thing very much like a pale blue credit card. LUNCH EATER (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You say Chase? Heather just nods, her heart in her throat.  The man's vo is surprisingly compassionate. LUNCH EATER (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry. He lifts the sheet carefully, just offering a peak at the face.  Heather forces herself to look. It's Chase, and something about the sweet sleep-like qual to his face hits Heather harder than the bloodless pallor the slightly broken-egg misshaping of his head. The man lowers the sheet and fetches a clipboard hanging the foot of the stainless steel table. LUNCH EATER (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just sign at the bottom, that's all we  need. But Heather is just staring at the sheet, head ever so  slightly tilted, as if there's one thing she saw under th she's not yet quite through with. HEATHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me see once more. LUNCH EATER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. HEATHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lift the sheet again. He looks, sees she's serious, and lifts it. HEATHER (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More. He lifts it a little more.  Still it's only down to Chase chin.  But it's enough, and in a deadly still voice Heath asks... HEATHER (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that? She's pointing to a flap of whitish skin beneath Chase's  chin. LUNCH EATER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, well, this was a bad wreck, ma'am.    I mean, his head's gonna be okay for the  funeral and all, but... Heather reaches out suddenly and pulls the sheet back muc farther.  For one horrendous instant we glimpse a torso s back together with rough mortician's stitches along four  deep, savage slashes. The lunch eater pulls the sheet back over Chase as Heathe spins and vomits. LUNCH EATER (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, now, there.  You okay, lady? He offers her a piece of white muslin to wipe her mouth. does so with shaking hands, then asks with a shaken,  terrified whisper. HEATHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did that? The man blinks a moment. LUNCH EATER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ma'am, it was head-on.  I heard the truck  was torn up something awful.  You can  imagine how he'd, well, not be exactly in  top shape. Heather, still crouched, looks back at the gurney looming above her. HEATHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It looks like...he was clawed. LUNCH EATER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, well, that's why we don't lift the  sheet past the face, ma'am.  Sometimes  what you don't see is what gets you  through the night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Surrounded by her friends, Heather buries her husband.  T are several recognizable faces here in addition to Bob an Sara, especially to Elm Street fans - Robert Englund, JOH DEPP, WES CRAVEN, JOHN SAXON among others.  There is no m or fans - the funeral has been kept from the press. Heather stands apart from the rest, holding Dylan's hand. his other side is Julie, touching his shoulder.  Only a  slight twitching of the boy's hand betrays emotion as he  solemnly watches the casket lowered.  As it disappears  beneath the brink, a sudden WIND moves through the trees. A moment later a SHARP JOLT ROLLS THROUGH THE PLACE.   Instantly there are cries of EARTHQUAKE! and the SHOCK  CONTINUES - THE GROUND HEAVING - and the men winching the coffin fall backwards.  Several grave stones and monument tumble.  The coffin itself tilts wickedly, then falls end first into the pit, hitting with a sickening crack.  Heat lurches forward instinctively.  Loses balance.  Falls and hits hard, head against the framework over the grave. Mass confusion for the rest of the people, ducking, stumb over gravestones, generally grabbing for something solid. Then that eerie still again.  Just DOGS and CAR ALARMS. Heather shakes herself, twists round looking for Dylan. he's not with Julie.  Hisses desperately at the girl. HEATHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julie.  Where's Dylan?! Julie looks around, dazed.  Everyone nearby looks for the child.  And for god knows what reason, Heather checks the grave and reacts in horror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the merest fraction of a second we see the coffin has  split open.  The lid ajar.  And incredibly, the leering f of someone who looks a lot like FREDDY KRUEGER - darker, harder, but definitely in that mode, ducks back deeper in the dark of the coffin after a split second of eye-contac with Heather.  And he's dragging Dylan after him! Without hesitation Heather jumps into the pit.  Amid gasp astonishment from the dazed onlookers, even as Dylan  disappears into the coffin with a terrible yank!

dialogues.speaker: IN THE PIT WITH HEATER
dialogues.text: wrenching back the coffin lid, seeing Dylan about to vani down the dark slot at the foot of the coffin.  Just like danger area beneath the blankets!

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE COFFIN
dialogues.text: Heather diving under the winding sheets and grabbing Dyla hand.  Hauling back.  For the briefest instant she glimps the long arm of Freddy's red and green-striped sweater. wicked glove and blades.  All snaking down out of sight i darkness.  As his mocking laughter echoes over her, Heath hauls up with all her might.  Pulling the child back and the bloody remains of her husband.  Dylan screaming in  fright!  And at the sight of Chase's face, his dead eyes  staring in horror into her own.  Heather passes out!

dialogues.speaker: HER FACE
dialogues.text: rolling to the side.  And now gentler HANDS are touching Trying to rouse her.

dialogues.speaker: PULL BACK TO REVEAL
dialogues.text: Heather on the ground at the graveside.  Robert Englund, Craven and John Saxon hovering over her in concern.  She  looks around in panic. HEATHER (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dylan!? JOHN SAXON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's right here.  It's okay! Saxon points.  Heather turns, sees Dylan watching down at with that intense, eerie look.  Held by the frightened Ju A terrible dizziness sweeps over Heather. HEATHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What...happened? JOHN SAXON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quake knocked you off your feet.  You got  bumped pretty good, actually. (dabs blood from her forehead)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heather turns and sees men already have the coffin back  level.  The lid is not open - the coffin isn't split.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sirens and a faint hubbub from the surrounding city.  Tho gathered are clearly shaken, and the MINISTER raises his  hands as a subtle but ominous AFTERSHOCK rolls by. MINISTER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: May he rest in peace, children.  And my  you all get home safely! Immediately several head for their cars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: shivering.  She stands, turns to go and bumps right into  Robert Englund.  She gives a start.  He puts his hand on shoulder.  And moving in CLOSER, we can just hear him mur ROBERT ENGLUND

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If there's anything I can do, Heater.   Anything... And he moves off, pulling a wide-brimmed, not-quite Fredd hat over his head.  Heather watches him go as John Saxon a big arm around her.  Behind, Wes Craven looks up at the sky.  It's getting late in the day and the wind is pickin up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cottage huddled against strong Santa Ana's.  A  streetlight nearby throws eerie shadows on the roof.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heather lies in bed wide awake, listening to the wind how She pulls the blankets closer and tries to close her eyes Then she becomes aware of another sound, this one from  downstairs.  A MUFFLED SING-SONG, and a PAD OF SMALL FEET

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: stands, listening.  Grabs a robe and rushes down to

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heather peeks around the corner of the stairwell, and to dismay sees Dylan circling in the den, eyes closed, mouth slurring something. Sleepwalking. Heather crosses, not knowing whether to wake him or not. hovers by the TV for a moment.  It's also on, this one  running silent images of

dialogues.speaker: TV
dialogues.text: Heather as NANCY in the boiler room for the first time (a from NIGHTMARE I) seeing Freddy step out from behind the  furnace, backlit, dark, clawed.

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: reacting.  Scared now. Dylan, still asleep, veers away blindly, bumps into the  coffee table, then heads for the kitchen. Heather's had enough.  She catches up with him.  Softly  encircles him in her arms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as she shakes him gently. HEATHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dylan.  Sweetie.  Wake up, baby... Awakening, Dylan's eyes snap wide in fear.  His mouth gap open in a startled cry and he flails out of her arms onto floor.  Heather desperately trying to gather him back up. And then he seems to recognize her, and falls still.  Onl his labored breathing breaks the stunned silence, his eye staring wide at Heather. HEATHER (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dylan, baby, we're gonna get you back to  bed now. The child shakes his head violently, tears springing. DYLAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't sleep there, Mommy.  Please! HEATHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've got to sleep, Dylan, you... She never finishes the sentence because Dylan suddenly si a thin, plaintive voice DYLAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One two, Freddy's coming for you... Heather, feeling her head swim through an unexpected wash vertigo, can barely find her voice. HEATHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dylan, did you hear that in that move? Dylan looks at her, confused. DYLAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What movie? Heather looks at the TV.  There's nothing there.  The set off.  And not only that, it's still unplugged from that  morning.  She looks back at the child. HEATHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then...where did you hear that song?  Did  you answer the phone? Dylan shakes his head. DYLAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In my bed. HEATHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your bed? DYLAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Under my covers. (off her look)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kids singing, and way down there, the  man...the mean man... And he makes the sign of the claw. HEATHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And...what's the man doing? DYLAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trying to get up...trying to get into our  world. Then Dylan stops, startled by the warm run of liquid over upper lip.  His nose has started to coarse dark, red bloo HEATHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, shit.  Dylan. He touches his hand to it, stares at the bright surprise, then Heather snatches him up.  Rushes him into the bathro FRAMED IN THAT DISTANT DOORWAY she daubs his face, soothe his silent tears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heather, back in bed and listening to the wind HOWL.  Dyl is curled against her side.  Peaceful as a baby now.  Bre deep and regular.  But if Heather thinks he's asleep, she wrong. DYLAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's Daddy now? Heather gives a start.  Looks down.  Dylan's looking up a her, waiting for the answer. HEATHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daddy's...in Heaven, Dylan.  He's with  God now. Dylan thinks a moment. DYLAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you have to die to see God? HEATHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I don't think so.  You just have  to...pray, or reach... He curls against her, tighter. DYLAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why does God let there be bad things? HEATHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I honestly don't know. Try to sleep,  baby. DYLAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you come with me in my dreams? Heather pulls the cover over him farther. HEATHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think that only happens in movies.  But  I'll always be here when you get back. (looks under covers)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I'll make sure nobody grabs your  toes, either. She tickles his toes.  He lets out a giggle and closes hi eyes.  Heather does not close hers.  In fact, she reaches over and finds a still steaming cup of coffee stashed on bedside table and takes a long gulp.

dialogues.speaker: UNDER THE COVERS
dialogues.text: we see Dylan's HAND reach down and touch REX.  He turns t snarling beast to face the darkness at the bottom of the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sun a warm yellow, CHILDREN playing under the watchful ey of MOTHERS.  Nearby, Dylan runs a stick around the paling a playground rocket, somber and tentative. PAN TO FIND HEATHER AND JOHN SAXON.  The man in immaculat sweats, tan and fit.  A reassuring presence if ever there one, listening intently as Heather speaks. HEATHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know what he's doing is bizarre, but  most of the time he seems so normal, so  well adjusted.  I just can't believe it's  him.  I mean, and not something outside,  influencing him. (scared)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or is that how denial works? JOHN SAXON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When it is denial.  I don't think that's  the case here, but if you're really  worried, have a doctor check him out.   You'll see, everything's fine. Heather looks back at him. HEATHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not just saying that to help a  crazy friend cope, are you? Saxon shakes his head. JOHN SAXON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All of Dylan's behavior is understandable  for a kid dealing with a parent's death.   How can a child process such a thing? Heather shakes her head, saying low. HEATHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't know.  Haven't been able to process  it very well myself. Saxon looks at her. JOHN SAXON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not crazy, by the way. HEATHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thinking I saw Freddy in the grave feels  pretty crazy.  And jumping in... JOHN SAXON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You didn't jump in. HEATHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's my memory.  And it seemed  absolutely real. JOHN SAXON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seemed, not was. HEATHER (looks off, lower)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's in my family, you know.  My  grandmother died in an institution... JOHN SAXON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really? (unfazed)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hell, if having a screwy family made you  crazy, the world'd be one colossal  nuthouse. She looks at him, well?  He laughs and she does, too. JOHN SAXON (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, you've got a crazed fan after you.   That's what's making you crazy, and  probably Dylan, too. HEATHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've never mentioned it to him. JOHN SAXON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kids know when something's bugging a  parent. (focusing on it)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've got no idea who this is calling? She turns and watches Dylan. HEATHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Freddy, for all I know. JOHN SAXON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steady... Heather tries to smile. HEATHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A man, or a boy with a deep, y'know,  Freddy voice. JOHN SAXON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Six weeks of this, and you're surprised  you've got Freddy in your dreams?  Hell,  Sonny Bono says after a while he was  seeing his stalker everywhere.  Even at  Mass. HEATHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really? JOHN SAXON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Absolutely.  And how many times has  Letterman called the cops thinking that  woman was down in his kitchen again?  It  gets under your skin if you let it. HEATHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You really think Dylan's okay? Saxon gives her a paternal look. JOHN SAXON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dylan's fine.  You're fine.  Hurting, but  fine. Definitely not crazy.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO THE PLAYGROUND ROCKET
dialogues.text: a tall structure standing over 25 feet high.  Dylan has  unexpectedly made his way all the way to its top level, a has squeezed out through a broken guard band.  Right now climbing up the outside of the rocket towards its nose co

dialogues.speaker: BACK ON HEATHER
dialogues.text: not seeing any of this. HEATHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's my worst fear, that whatever my  mother had, I'll have.  And I'll pass it  along to... Heather shakes her head and smiles, then looks up and giv start, seeing

dialogues.speaker: DYLAN
dialogues.text: who's climbed to the pinnacle of the rocket and is standi fully upright on its nose cone, way the hell up there, ar stretched to the heavens! Heather stands, afraid to move.  And now several other  parents, even kids are seeing him, pointing, as

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: stretches up impossibly far, fingers straining.  Heather below, leaping off the bench and starting to run!

dialogues.speaker: DYLAN
dialogues.text: as he stretches even harder, and then with a cry loses hi balance and falls.

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: running at top speed.

dialogues.speaker: DYLAN
dialogues.text: falling through space.

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: barely making it to him.  The boy and her meeting with a jarring impact.  Heather driven to the sand hard, with Dy atop her! By the time Saxon gets to them, Heather's finding out tha though she's dazed and bruised, amazingly, Dylan is not o okay, but serenely unconcerned with his close call.  He  simply looks up at her and says solemnly. DYLAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God wouldn't take me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peaceful, sun-drenched.  Never know anything was going wr Heather, limping noticeably, fetches her mail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heather wipes the sweat off her face with her T-shirt and shuffles through the pile.  There's a newspaper with  headlines of the earthquake, the usual load of junk mail and then something that stops her cold.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as she singles out one letter in particular.  Grimy, no  address, smeared with soot.  She opens it with shaking  fingers. We see a sheet of filthy paper holding a single out "E" pasted on its center.

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: stuffs the letter in a drawer,and as she does we glimpse  dozens of other filthy ENVELOPES. Heather crosses to the phone and dials. VOICE #2 (FILTER)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello? HEATHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robert?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TIGHT ON ENGLUND, intense, quick, stalking back from the  cordless phone's base through the living room of a large, Mediterranean mansion.  He talks as he walks, soon ending back where he evidently was when the call came, in a sun- off the larger room, which features a large easel.  Clear an avid amateur painter, he's surrounded here by jars of  brushes, rags and palettes.  The large canvas he's workin is seen only from behind. ROBERT ENGLUND

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heather?  You doing okay? HEATHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holding my own.  You know that guy who  was calling me all the time?  He's  started again.  He's been putting stuff  in my mail. ROBERT ENGLUND

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Must've read about the funeral.  Sick  mother.  That's the last thing you need  right now, I'm sure. HEATHER (almost embarrassed)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's actually been giving me Freddy  nightmares. Line noise for a second, then... ROBERT ENGLUND

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Freddy as in me? Heather shakes her head. HEATHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It isn't you. He's scarier.  He's... (searching for words)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robert puts down his brush, takes the portable phone to t window and looks out as if he could see her. ROBERT ENGLUND

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Darker.  More...evil? HEATHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah...how'd you know? ROBERT ENGLUND

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Call it a guess... He starts painting again, as if he saw something in the  canvas he had to capture instantly or it would vanish.  H face twists and flinches with the effort; we get the feel this is no mere hobby at all.  But we still don't see the picture. HEATHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anyway, what I was calling about  was...have you seen any of the script, by  any chance? ROBERT ENGLUND

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wes won't show it until it's finished.   That's what he told me, at least.  I  asked him at the funeral. HEATHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When do you think it'll be done? ROBERT ENGLUND

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The way he's writing is so weird, who  knows?  I asked him how far he'd gotten  at the funeral, and what was it he  said...?  Oh yeah, as far as Dylan trying  to reach God.  Weird, huh, that he'd have  your kid in it? Heather can't find her breath for a moment.  Fighting a  perception of fear so stifling it's like a pillow pressed her face.  She barely manages. HEATHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robert?  Have you been having any  nightmares? Just the line noise.

dialogues.speaker: ON ROBERT
dialogues.text: painting, the phone held away from his head as if it cont something he doesn't want to acknowledge. HEATHER (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robert, I think we should talk.  And not  over the phone.  Could I come over? He shakes his head. ROBERT ENGLUND

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, actually today's not good.  There's  something I've got to finish.  How's  tomorrow?

dialogues.speaker: BACK NOW WITH HEATHER
dialogues.text: pale, turning to look at Dylan's door. HEATHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tomorrow, then. First thing in the  morning.  Meanwhile take care, Robert,  okay? She hangs up.

dialogues.speaker: ROBERT
dialogues.text: hangs up, too, just staring at the painting.  As if it he his salvation or his doom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heather, deep in sleep, tossing as if her bed were floati on a stormy sea.  In fact, this time very, very subtly,  another EARTHQUAKE has begun rocking the house.  Lamps sw the whole bed rises and falls, as we

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
