dialogues.text: CAMERA AT CARPET LEVEL as two little FEET pad INTO FRAME. MOVE WITH THEM, TILTING UP the cowboy PJ's TO DYLAN'S FAC Ghostlike in the moonlight.  Eyes vacant, moving through living room as in a dream.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heather gasps out something in her sleep, the tone deeply distressed.  PAN OFF HER, ACROSS THE SHEET FLUNG OVER HER THE FOOT OF THE BED.  There's movement there.  The sheet  rising at four salients.  Pressed up from beneath.  Then glint of steel pokes through with a subtle rip-rip-rip, t claws of finely-honed steel rise into moonlight.  Moving. PAST HEATHER'S FACE TO THE CLAWS cleanly parting the shee they pull their way closer to her.  The only sound a soft RRRIIIIIPPPPP. THEY STOP IN CU and with practiced SNICK cut the tatters  between them, leaving only a single hole. Then the lethal steel hand rises fully into sight.  Then there's a CRASH from downstairs, as if a silverware  drawer were dumped on a tile floor. Heather JOLTS as if prodded with an electric wire, twists around and stares wide-eyed at NOTHING.  OUR WIDE ANGLE FROM DIRECTLY ABOVE SHOWS twiste blankets, nothing more. Chilled, Heather pulls the sheet around her.  Then pulls back open.  Realizes it's cut into ribbons along its enti length. She jumps out of bed, breath caught in her throat.  Then  there's a METALLIC SCRRRIIIIITCH from the kitchen. DYLAN (O.S.) (distant)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One two, Freddy's coming for you.  Three  four, better lock your door...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heather appears at the foot of the stairs, heart in her  throat.  Twenty feet away, advancing slowly from the kitc Dylan is chanting the old refrain DYLAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Five six, grab your crucifix... Heather starts for him. REVERSE ANGLE PAST DYLAN TO HEATHER, and from this vantag point, we can see the cluster of steak knives he's taped his fingers, making a serious-looking claw, hidden behind back.  Heather shakes her head, almost to him. HEATHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sweetie, don't sing that... She reaches for him, and he strikes like lightning, slash barely missing.  Advances again, breath coming in little  asthmatic rasps.  Heather backs away. DYLAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seven eight, better stay up late! She bangs up against a wall, he's too near for her to dod away.  They grapple, the boy suddenly with the strength o feral animal.  He raises the blades, hissing at her DYLAN (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nine ten! Heather lurches backwards as he strikes, and

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CRASH! she falls out of bed, now truly awake. DYLAN (O.S.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never sleep again. Pad, pad, pad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heather enters, limping.  Looks.  Sees her child circling the center of the room before the lit TV, crying softly.. DYLAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never sleep again, never sleep again... And scattered all around him on the floor are the filthy  pages of letters. HEATHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dylan... Then she stops, staring more closely at the letters on th carpet.  For the first time she sees that using the singl letter from each page, Dylan has spelled out:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then the phone RINGS. Heather stares at Dylan, stunned.  The phone RINGS again, without even thinking about it, she picks it up. HEATHER (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes? FREDDY (FILTER)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I touched him. Before she can react the telephone suddenly thrusts a lon fleshy tongue into her mouth in an appallingly obscene li She flails backwards, flinging it away, and as she does,  Dylan lets out a piercing scream and falls gasping on his side, legs kicking like an animal struck by a car. Heather grabs him and runs for the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DOCTOR HEFNER, a tall, powerful looking woman in her 40's Chief of Pediatric Medicine, clicks off the light and loo at Heather. DR. HEFNER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Any history of epilepsy in your family? HEATHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. DR. HEFNER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Diabetes? HEATHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. DR. HEFNER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Was there any trigger event?  A trauma,  shock or... (looks at her more carefully)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You haven't shown him any of the films  you make, have you?  The horror stuff? HEATHER (not sure she imagined it or  not)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No... Hefner nods, scowling. DR. HEFNER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good.  I'm convinced they can tip an  unstable child over the edge. Heather swallows, hardly able to find her voice. HEATHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unstable?  Dylan's not unstable, he's...  just...upset. The doctor's looks at her, as if wondering if Heather's  competent enough to handle a painful truth.  Then she jus scrawls something on a prescription sheet. DR. HEFNER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll run a battery of tests and know in  a few days. Heather looks at Dylan, eyes haunted by a terrible  vulnerability. Dylan is stone silent.  No evil behavior.  Just exhausted withdrawn, like some small creature escaped from a predat by the skin of his teeth, now just following core instinc stay in hiding.  Do not make a sound. HEATHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does he have to stay here over night? DR. HEFNER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Absolutely. The doctor draws her out into

dialogues.speaker: HALLWAY OUTSIDE DYLAN'S ROOM
dialogues.text: She holds Heather's eye and speaks low, so Dylan can't he DR. HEFNER (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anything more happen we should know  about? Heather tenses ever-so-slightly. HEATHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like what? DR. HEFNER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sometimes what a child says or fantasizes  will give a clue to what ails him.  Did  he say anything while he was still lucid? Heather looks to Dylan.  He's looking at her with trustin eyes. HEATHER (low)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  Dylan didn't say anything. She goes into the room.  Dr. Hefner watches her carefully nurse walks by and Hefner hands her the X-rays. NURSE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What have we here? DR. HEFNER (low)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's too soon to know for sure, but the  early symptoms point towards childhood  schizophrenia.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TIGHT ON HEATHER AND DYLAN.  Heather has heard the above  exchange.  Near tears, she looks down to Dylan curled aga her, eyes open but unseeing.  Staring not so much at her past her, out the window. HEATHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dylan, can you hear me? Just barely perceptibly, the terrified boy shakes his hea 'no'. HEATHER (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dylan, you've got to fight it, whatever  it is that's after you.  And you've got  to come back to me.  You can't make it  alone.  Do you hear?

dialogues.speaker: ON DYLAN
dialogues.text: No response to this.  But then a single tear courses down cheek.  And then he nods 'yes'. HEATHER (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.  And if you can hear me, you can  tell me what you need to feel safe. He says nothing.  But then Heather is aware of movement. looks down and sees Dylan's hand moving under the covers, reaching, reaching down towards the bottom of the bed, fo something that clearly is not there. HEATHER (cont'd) (realizing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rex?  Is that what you want?  Rex is  home, Dylan. That's where you should be,  too.  You've got to get better so they'll  let you come home, understand?! DYLAN (very, very quietly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Home. HEATHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Home, that's right. She points out the window. HEATHER (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's where I want you, Dylan.  You know  we're not that far.  Right out there past  the freeway is our home.  But to get  there you've got to come out from where  you are.  Then they'll let you come back  home to Rex...and to me. She kisses him gently on his forehead, crying herself now Then a NURSE ENTERS with a paper cup. NURSE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Time for your medicine, cowboy. Dylan looks at it solemnly. HEATHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is that? NURSE (quietly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just something to help him sleep. Heather looks at Dylan and nods.  Then as if he were a  thousand years old, Dylan puts it in his mouth.  The nurs gives him water and he swallows. NURSE (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Attaboy.  Now take a little nap. (to Heather)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll have to leave now. He'll be fine.   We'll run tests tonight.  You can visit  again in the morning. The nurse leaves.  Heather turns to Dylan. HEATHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, Dylan.  I'll be back here first  thing tomorrow.  I love you. Heather kisses him again, gives a little wave, and leaves Dylan closes his eyes. But when Heather disappears through the doorway behind, h brings his hand to his mouth and spits the sleeping pill his palm.  A moment later he's hidden it deep in his bed  covers, and his eyes are wide open, staring out through t window again, to his home over there, so near yet so far  away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heather, in her Volvo, starts to back out, lost in though Instantly there's a BLARE OF HORN and CURSES from the car she's almost backed into.  Heather pulls back into the  parking place and kills the engine. She just sits there and sobs, for one moment all the  confusion and dread surging out of her.  Then she forces  herself to breathe.  Swipes away the tears.  Swears to  herself.  And starts the engine.

dialogues.speaker: INT/EXT. HEATHER'S VOLVO
dialogues.text: Heather drives and drinks 7/11 coffee.  She's got the RAD on loud to fight drooping eyes. RADIO NEWSCASTER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seismologists at CalTech have counted  over 300 of the temblors so far.  Though  most were too faint for us to feel, seven  have shaken our community in the last two  weeks.  And now scientists are  speculating there might be an unknown  fault running beneath Los Angeles, a  fault that could... Heather turns it OFF.  Thinks a moment, then punches numb on the carphone and listens to it cycle and RING.  Somebo picks up immediately. PATRICE (SPEAKER)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robert? HEATHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is Heather, Patrice.  I was calling  for Robert.  He's not there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PATRICE, Robert's wife, 33, a face of great strength and  beauty, looking a bit dazed and edgy right now, moves thr the living room with a suitcase.  She puts is down with t others, then starts for the studio. PATRICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's...out of the house, Heather. HEATHER (FILTER)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will he be back any time soon? PATRICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh...actually, we're ducking out of town  for a while.

dialogues.speaker: ON HEATHER
dialogues.text: sensing the woman's near panic. PATRICE (cont'd) (on speaker)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you should get away, too, Heather.   You really should.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO ENGLUND'S
dialogues.text: Patrice has stopped in the studio to grab Robert's glasse She stuffs them into a pocket, turns and looks off PATRICE (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just a little break away from L.A.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO WHAT SHE'S LOOKING AT
dialogues.text: The IMPRESSIONISTIC PAINTING Englund was working on.  A  LARGE, FRIGHTENING PORTRAIT OF FREDDY HIMSELF.  A being f more dark and ominous that the usual version.  The one we (and Heather) glimpsed in Chase's coffin.  As different i kind as the film Batman was from the TV version.   He's larger, quick and feral, yet at the same time imbued with enormous strength and intelligence.  A truly primal  threat from the lowest ring of hell.  And the large gleam steel hand and claws, cocked and ready to strike, grow ri out of the end of his arm. PATRICE (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We could all use a break right about now,  don't you think?

dialogues.speaker: BACK ON HEATHER
dialogues.text: as the line goes dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A modern home high above MALIBU.  PAN ACROSS A POOL to a  PATIO, where we DISCOVER WES and HEATHER walking together WES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wish I could tell you where this script  is going.  I don't know.  Look, I dream a  scene, I write it down the next morning.   Your guess is as good as mine as to how  it ends. He ducks inside, Heather running to catch up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HEATHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well at least tell me what it's about so  far. Wes stops as his HOUSEKEEPER emerges from the kitchen wit steaming cup of coffee.  Heather drinks immediately, desp the scalding heat.  When the housekeeper disappears, Crav continues. WES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can tell you what the nightmares are  about.  They're about this...entity.   Whatever you want to call it.  It's old,  very old, and it's taken different forms  in different times.  The only thing that  stays the same about it is what it lives  for. HEATHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that? WES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Killing innocence, one way or the other. She notices the haunted eyes. HEATHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is still a script we're talking  about, right? WES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think of it as sort of a nightmare in  progress. She looks at him, he stares back, revealing nothing. HEATHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then, in this nightmare in progress, does  this thing have any weaknesses? WES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It can be captured, sometimes. HEATHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captured?  How? WES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: By storytellers, of all things.  Every so  often, they imagine a story good enough  to catch its essence.  Then it's held  prisoner for a while.  In the story. She looks at him. HEATHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like the Genie in the bottle. WES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exactly. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The problem comes when the story dies.   It happens a lot of different ways, the  story gets too familiar, or too watered  down by people trying to make it easier  to sell, or ti's labeled a threat to  society and just plain banned.  However  it happens, when the story dies, the evil  is set free. Heather blinks as it hits her. HEATHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You saying Freddy's this ancient thing? WES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Current version.  For ten years he's been  imprisoned as Freddy by the story of  Nightmare on Elm Street.  But now that  the films have stopped- (looks at her)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The genie's out of the bottle, Heather,  that's what the nightmares are about.   That's what I'm writing. She looks at him, fear creeping up her spine. HEATHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If Freddy's loose, I mean, in your  script, where's he going to go?  Another  age?  Another form? WES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not what the dreams say he's  doing. HEATHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then what is he doing? WES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, see, he's gotten used to being  Freddy now.  And kinda likes it here in  our time and space, too.  So...he's  trying to cross over, from film into our  reality. Heather looks like she might pass out. HEATHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isn't there anyone that can stop him? WES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Interestingly enough, in the dreams there  is one person.  A gatekeeper, so to  speak.  Someone Freddy's got to get by  before he can enter our world. (looks at her)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's you, Heather. HEATHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me?  Why me? WES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dramatically speaking it makes perfect  sense.  You played Nancy, after all, the  first to humiliate and defeat him. HEATHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was Nancy, not me! WES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But it was you that gave Nancy her  strength.  So to get out he has to come  through you.  And it's inevitable that  he'll hit you at your most vulnerable  points... Heater pales. HEATHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dylan.  And... (realizes)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chase.  My God, Wes, did you know? WES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heather, it's just a movie, a dream,  really... HEATHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know damn well it's more than that  now! (lower)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How can we stop him? He stops in the doorway to his studio.  Heather sees this room is draped against the light.  In its center glows a  computer, a half-finished page of script on its screen. to the computer, a narrow cot, its sheets twisted. WES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The way to stop him is to make another  movie.  And I swear to you I'll stay at  my computer and keep writing until I  finish the script.  But when that time  comes... (quietly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're gonna have to make a choice. HEATHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Choice?  What kind of choice? WES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whether or not you're willing to play  Nancy one last time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heather studies long into the night, a host of books spre around her.  Yellow pads for notes, and she's brought the coffee-maker right into the bedroom now.  It sits promine on her bedside table.

dialogues.speaker: BOOKS
dialogues.text: Chilton on Childhood Diseases, Barton & O'Neil's text on  Pediatric Schizophrenia; Xeroxes from Scientific American the Journal of the AMA, Lancet, Journal of the American  Psychological Institute.

dialogues.speaker: CU HER FINGERS
dialogues.text: tracing complex paragraphs.

dialogues.speaker: XCU OF TEXTUAL FRAGMENTS
dialogues.text: SARA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...incipience of aphasia commonly  preceded by periods of acute  irritability...delusional accounts of  shadow figures... hearing of voices...  seizures, nausea and emesis...

dialogues.speaker: CU OF HEATHER'S EYES
dialogues.text: reading, reacting subtly as the fear and awful doubts mou Then she loses her grip momentarily on the book, and seve pages turn.  She tries to find her place.  Then straighte

dialogues.speaker: XCU NEW TEXT
dialogues.text: under a heading of SLEEP DISORDERS, the words 'many of th symptoms of schizophrenia are duplicated in children  suffering from sleep deprivation.'

dialogues.speaker: XXCU THE WORDS "SLEEP DEPRIVATION"
dialogues.text: CU OF HER HAND REACHING FOR HER CUP OF COFFEE, stopping  inches from the cup. XCU HEATHER'S EYE, shifting to the cup. XCU COFFEE CUP, the black surface of the coffee radiating concentric rings, subtle at first, then larger and larger until the fluid is sloshing over the brim.

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: goes rigid, braces looking around.  There's a distinct LO RUMBLE BUILDING now, with a responding CREAKING COMPLAINT from the timbers of the house. Then the TV IN HER ROOM BLINKS ON, at first silently, so she's not even sure she's heard its subtle 'blink'.  Then volume comes up, and she finds herself watching a newstor the days earthquake, FOOTAGE (STOCK) of brick walls atop  smashed cars, freeway overpasses cracked and closed off. ANNOUNCER (TV/VO)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A six-point quake on the Richter Scale,  bringing scattered destruction throughout  L.A. Basin... HEATHER fumbles in the drawer of her bedtable and finds t remote, aims and fires and the  TV BLINKS OFF.  BEAT.  THEN BLINKS BACK ON.

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: just stares at it.  What is going on, here? She's about to beep it off again when she stops, the stor segueing to: ANNOUNCER (TV/VO cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The world of horror films suffered its  own terror today, as two of Hollywood's  best-known special effects technicians  were found dead in a vacant field. THE TV SWITCHES to a late-night NEWSCASTER with the SUPER IMPOSED LOGO of FREDDY'S CLAW and the TEXT: REAL-LIFE HOR ANNOUNCER (TV/VO cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terrance Feinstein and Charles Wilson,  two special effects artists reputedly  working on a top-secret project for the  makers of the Freddy Krueger films, were  found brutally slashed to death early  this. Heather beeps it off, and the TV stays black.  She breath sigh of relief, badly shaken.  Then it comes back on. ANNOUNCER (TV/VO cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Freddy's glove was missing, and police  are speculating whether the murders were  the result of a botched theft of... GZZZTTT!!! The picture contorts, goes to snow and dies.   There's an interior, bluish flare inside the TV, and a wi of smoke.  Then silence. Then the phone rings.  Heather just stares at it.   IT RINGS AGAIN.  Then her answering machine picks up  downstairs. SARA (FILTER)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heather?  This is Sara.  Um, sorry to  call so late, but...this is kinda hard...  I don't know if you've seen the news,  but... we just are thinking we might  shelf this new Nightmare project for a  while, and wanted you to know.  Call.   Bye. CLICK. Heather leans back against her pillows.  Closes her eyes takes a deep breath.  Just the sound of the WIND now.  He head falls slowly sideways. Then the first plate falls in the kitchen, then another, sharp, harrowing CRASHING of crockery.  And Heather dives of bed, stumbling for the doorway as the full force of th earthquake hits! KABLAM!  Heather braces in the doorway, gritting her teet things throughout the house topple now, something big in living room, both lamps off the bedside tables, this is t worst quake yet! Then the LIGHTS GO OUT.  Heather lets out a cry of terror adrenaline.  At last, it's over. A moment's silence.  Then one final CRASH.  Glass from th sound of it.  Then utter, preternatural silence. Heather holds, waiting for the aftershock.  But there is  none.  Then she starts to wonder about that last crash.   There's enough moonlight to tell the direction of it, the closet. She looks.  The rest she can guess, but what the hell was the closet?  She crosses and opens the door, looking down see The broken remains of her coffee pot.  She looks back to bedside table.  The coffee pot is gone. The merest sound brings her head around, and she finds  herself looking into a face not ten inches from her own, dark, scarred figure, face contorted with menace, eyes  catching the scant light just enough to glint incredible  hatred and energy. Heather lets out the scream at the same second he strikes lunging forward and driving her backwards over the bed,  landing atop and pressing his ugly face right into hers. there's enough of the moonlight to glimpse the pocked and crisped skull. FREDDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Naaaaancy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: and he drives down hard, but as he does, the bed suddenly twists up and over at the same instant, and the AFTERSHOC HITS!  Heather is thrown to the side at the last possible second.  The blades slashing past her throat and hitting up-thrust arm, a split second before she careens out of b entirely. Hitting the floor hard, knocking herself out cold.  As th quake's last RUMBLES shake the room, then fall away.

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: on the deck.  Shaking herself back to consciousness.  Loo around in shock. The room is normal.  Only her bed seems affected, so aske half the mattress touches the floor. She raises herself painfully.  Her bedside clock radio is blinking "12:00...12:00".  She realizes she's clutching h arm, that there's blood oozing between her fingers. Then she remembers. HEATHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dylan!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERA MOVING HANDHELD WITH HEATHER as she runs down the  corridor towards Dylan's room.  Then she sees

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: staring back at her, stopped by a nurse. HEATHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julie, what're you doing here? Julie gives a funny shrug. JULIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.  I just...had this terrible  dream...that Dylan was in danger.  I had  to come over to see... (laughs nervously)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You must think I'm crazy. Heather shakes her head. HEATHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I don't think that at all.  How is  he? JULIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They wouldn't let me... At that moment Dr. Hefner strides into sight.  She looks Heather with a slightly pained smile. DR. HEFNER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ms. Langenkamp.  I'm afraid there are no  evening visiting hours in Intensive Care. HEATHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is he all right? DR. HEFNER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dylan?  He's holding well.  Earlier he  had some problems, he's in an oxygen tent  just now... HEATHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God... She goes to pass but the doctor stops her, looking down a her sleeve. DR. HEFNER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It seems we've had an accident, Mrs.  Langekamp.  May I? Heather looks down. She's forgotten entirely about her  bloodied arm. The doctor lifts the sleeve.  Sees the four slashes across the forearm. DR. HEFNER (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Those are nasty cuts.  How... HEATHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It happened during the earthquake.  I  fell.  I want to see Dylan... But the doctor doesn't move out of the way.  She looks fr the cuts to Heather's face, seeing the fear and stress. DR. HEFNER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In a moment, first let's see about you. She takes Heather's elbow.  Heather glances towards Julie then goes with her to...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heather sits while the doctor treats the cuts.  Heather's obviously uneasy and wishing to be with her son, but the  Doctor isn't taking the cuts lightly, and is increasingly alert to Heather's highly agitated state. DR. HEFNER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If these had been a few inches nearer to  the wrist... What did you say you cut  yourself on? HEATHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was an earthquake and it was dark.  I  have no idea. DR. HEFNER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These look quite fresh. HEATHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They are...it happened in tonight's  quake. (off her blank look)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It happened just fifteen minutes ago.   You must've felt it. The doctor has no idea what she's talking about. DR. HEFNER (smiles faintly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guess we lucked out over here. Heather swallows.  The doctor begins bandaging. DR. HEFNER (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your son, apparently, is terrified of a  man. Someone he thinks is going to come  out of his bed. (off her look)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One of the nurses heard him talking in  his sleep  You have any idea who that man  might be, Mrs. Langenkamp? Heather winces as the woman binds the gauze with a clip. HEATHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I meant to bring him his dinosaur, Rex.   Rex keeps Freddy from... Heather realizes what she's said, but too late. DR. HEFNER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The man from your films?  Freddy Krueger  with the claws?  Is that who he's afraid  of? (eyes flick to Heather's arm)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have let your child see your films,  haven't you? Heather turns and faces the woman, furious. HEATHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Every kid knows about Freddy.  He's like  Santa Claus or King Kong. Dr. Hefner just eyes her, too appalled to take it further DR. HEFNER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I see.  Well.  Interesting talking to  you, Ms. Langenkamp.  I hope you  understand, my concerns are simply for  the welfare of your son. She smiles thinly and leaves the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dylan, now visible only through the plastic of an oxygen  tent. Heather sits next to her son's bed, exhausted.  Just watc his slow breathing.  Trying to piece it all together.   A nurse passes, glances at Heather and exchanges a whispe word with a SECOND NURSE. Heather, despite her best efforts, is nodding.  Suddenly  there's a shrill ALARM from a monitor and Dylan twists  sharply inside his tent, suffering what looks like the fu cardiac arrest.  Arched across the bed, fingers clawing t air in silent agony. Heather jerks awake as several NURSES rush in, looks back Dylan, sees he's half sitting up now, his eyes open, peer back at her with incredible intensity as he unzips the ox tent. It stops her short.  She leans closer. HEATHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dylan, honey.  You shouldn't do that! Dylan's face twists slowly into an uncanny imitation of a old man, and the voice that comes out of this child's mou is absolutely recognizable, absolutely Freddy Krueger's. DYLAN/FREDDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Too late.  I'm almost there, Heather, I'm  almost there. And with that Dylan vomits.  A huge involuntary convulsio that sends green/black effluvia straight into her eyes! Heather lurches back, clawing at the stinging globs cling to her face, her hair.  We glimpse insects, worms and wor

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emergency machinery flying in.  Heather pushed back.  Nur scurrying.  The SOUND of Dylan CRYING in a daze for his  mother. Then Dr. Hefner strides in and roughly shoves the nurses  away. HEATHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doctor... DR. HEFNER (to nurses)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get her back!  I've got to go in!  Get me  a full anesthetic, STAT! NURSE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We don't have any here, doctor. The doctor, grim-faced and furious, wheels back to Dylan, clawing the oxygen tent away. DR. HEFNER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Screw it, then.  I'm going in! She rips the terrified child's gown away from his chest. DR. HEFNER (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cut this evil out of him! And with that, she pulls her hand out of her bag and we s the grim glove.  A medicalized version of the gleaming,  TINGING scalpel-sharp claws.  Dr. Hefner raises them to  plunge into the child.  Heather lurches forward. HEATHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nooooo!

dialogues.speaker: STILL IN THE ROOM
dialogues.text: the crazed Dr. Hefner is not there.  But Heather has dive right onto Dylan's bed.  Now several NURSES struggle to  subdue her.  Heather fights one last second, then realize what's happened. NURSE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now what have you done to yourself, Miss? Heather looks down and sees the blood seeping out from un the bandage on her arm.  Then she looks back DYLAN'S BED.  The oxygen tent shredded.  And Dylan gone. Heather loses it. HEATHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's got him.  He's got my Dylan! The nurses wheel and stare at her.  Wild, trembling, and with a stark streak of gray slashed through her auburn ha NURSE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who?  Who's got him? Heather sees the looks of people clearly thinking she's n But she doesn't give a shit.  She realizes now what's  happened in the brief moment she was asleep. HEATHER (low)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Freddy... NURSE #2

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Freddy...? (laughs)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who, Freddy Krueger or something? Just at that point the real Dr. Hefner comes in.  Takes i the situation in an instant and asks HEATHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My baby.  Freddy's got my baby!  He's got  my Dylan! The doctor seizes Heather roughly by the arms and shakes until she looks at him. DR. HEFNER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ms. Langenkamp.  I suggest you go home  and get some rest.  Your son is fine.   He's been taken downstairs for further  testing. HEATHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was just here! DR. HEFNER (as to a retarded child)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was here.  You fell asleep.  We took  him.  You looked so exhausted, frankly,  we didn't wake you.  Besides, the young  woman, Julie, is with him.  Believe me,  everything is fine. HEATHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everything is not fine! And she bolts out of the room.  Hefner swears under her  breath and snaps to a nurse. DR. HEFNER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Call security.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MOVING WITH HEATHER HAND-HELD.  The woman in mid-argument with several nurses as she charges down the corridor. HEATHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is he? TESTING NURSE #1

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is a restricted area.  Do you have a  pass?! The nurse tries to grab Heather.  Heather shoves her away with a warning look. HEATHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Screw your pass! Just then Dr. Hefner catches up. DR. HEFNER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's all right, now...Ms. Langenkamp,  just remain calm. (glance to nurse)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell us how our boy is doing. The nurse flicks a look at Heather. NEEDLE NURSE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's fine, actually.  He came out of coma  ten minutes ago. (just to Hefner, lower)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's looking like acute sleep  deprivation.  I don't think she ever lets  the kid get a night's sleep. DR. HEFNER (more to herself)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Munchausen syndrome...? Heather pushes over. HEATHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What're you saying?  Where is he? The door behind them opens and two SECURITY GUARDS appear Hefner stops them with a hand signal, hearing... JULIE (O.S.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Over here, Heather. Heather turns to see Julie, motioning from a door.  Beami JULIE (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got someone here who wants to see you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heather runs into

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dylan's wide awake on a small examination table, and the  moment he sees Heather he holds out his arms.

dialogues.speaker: THEM
dialogues.text: as they embrace, both speaking in whispers, affording  themselves the only privacy they can. HEATHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You okay, champ? DYLAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can we go get Rex, now?  The bad man's  getting awful close. HEATHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know he is, sweetie.  We'll both go get  Rex right now. She starts to pick up Dylan, then stops.  Dylan's looking over her shoulder.  She turns and sees Dr. Hefner. DR. HEFNER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm afraid Dylan really should stay with  us until we know what's causing these  episodes, Ms. Langenkamp.  I'm sure you  understand. Heather looks back to Dylan.  Motions for Julie to come i close with them. HEATHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell you what.  I'm gonna go get Rex for  you right now.  You know home isn't far  from here, right? DYLAN (remembering)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right 'cross the freeway. HEATHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right.  So I won't be long.   Meanwhile Julie's gonna be right here  with you. JULIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You bet. Julie takes his hand. Dylan seems to take comfort in that but still he leans closer to Heather and begs. DYLAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hurry back, please.  I'm sleepy. HEATHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Promise.  Cross my heart. (kisses him)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But until Mommy gets back, Dylan,  whatever you do, don't fall asleep. She turns to Julie. HEATHER (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't let him out of your sight, Julie.   And keep him awake! Julie, thank God, accepts this at face value. JULIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll stick to him like glue, Heather.   Swear to God.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heather comes out and starts for the exit.  But she doesn get more than a few steps before the two Security Guards out of nowhere and take her by each elbow. HEATHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey! And before she knows it, Heather is hustled into the same dispensary where Dr. Hefner patched her up earlier.  And  there the good doctor waits now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heather is pressed into a chair by the guards. HEATHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DO you mind... DR. HEFNER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just a quick word, Ms. Langenkamp.  For  Dylan's sake. The security men post themselves at the door.  Dr. Hefner exchanges a glance with the nurses, and they vanish from room.  Heather has no choice right now. DR. HEFNER (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, it's been an exciting few days for  you, hasn't it, Ms. Langenkamp? HEATHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you don't mind, I've got something  more important to do than to make small  talk. She starts to rise but the doctor presses her back down w a look that means business. DR. HEFNER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Won't you please be patient.  All of this  is just routine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julie and Dylan look up to see...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: the two nurses enter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DYLAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh-oh... Julie stands.  One nurse goes directly to a cabinet and  begins rummaging inside.  The second walks past Julie to  stand by Dylan.  Julie, instantly alert, crosses to the n at the cabinet as the woman pulls out a very large needle vial. NURSE AT CABINET

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you mind stepping outside for just  one moment, miss? JULIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As a matter of fact, I would.  What do  you think you're doing? The nurse has already filled the syringe and now squirts the air bubble. NURSE AT CABINET

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just a little shot to see that he gets  some sleep. JULIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No way.  His mother specifically said... The nurse moves for Dylan.  Julie grabs her.  The nurse j stops and looks at her with a strange smirk of a smile. NURSE AT CABINET

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do it. DYLAN (O.S.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ow! Julie spins around.  The second nurse is just withdrawing needle of her own from Dylan's arm, having caught both of them off-guard. NURSE #2 (childlike)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All done. Dylan lets out a little wail of despair. NURSE AT CABINET (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He'll be asleep in no time.  Mind letting  go of my arm. Julie goes red. JULIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bitch! And she brings around a left hook that sends the nurse  reeling backwards...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: and out the door.  The woman lands flat on her back in th hall!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julie stares in shock, hardly believing she's done that. the second nurse rears up behind her... NURSE #2

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey!  You can't do that! Julie grabs the large syringe dropped by the KO'd nurse a levels it at the other.  Nurse #2 holds her own a moment, two facing each other needle to needle. JULIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know what's in that one.  Do you know  what's in this one? (nurse #2 wavers)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or what it'll do when I stick you with  it?  And I will... She feints.  Nurse #2 drops her syringe like a hot potato

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: runs out the room!  Julie slams the door and locks it.   Then...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: she runs to Dylan. JULIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dylan.  Don't fall asleep!  Dylan!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Hefner pulls up a stool and sits directly before Heat leaning in closer still. DR. HEFNER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ms. Langenkamp, has...there been any use  of recreational drugs in your family?  Or  any history of mental disturbance? Heather's eyes flash with barely suppressed rage. HEATHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell are you asking? The woman raises her hands in a practiced non-threatening gesture. DR. HEFNER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please don't take this wrong.  But if  there was, there's a good chance Dylan  could be suffering from something passed  down to him. (leaning closer)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you been suffering from any  delusional events, Ms. Langenkamp? Heather starts to stand again, but this time the security guards push her back down.  Heather looks back to Dr. Hef a cold snake of fear now coiling up her spine. DR. HEFNER (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This man from your films...Freddy  Krueger... Have you been seeing him? HEATHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! Heather looks down.  The bandage on her arm is seeping bl She looks back to Hefner, a flick of desperation in her e DR. HEFNER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There are drugs and treatments, Ms.  Langenkamp.  We could place Dylan in  foster care for a short while.  Run some  tests on you... Heather cuts Hefner off with a deadly cold wave of her ha Gets up.  Bumps against the guards. HEATHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want my kid out of here now! DR. HEFNER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very well. As soon as we gather the  appropriate papers... HEATHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't understand.  If Dylan falls  asleep,then... Heather turns at an O.S. SOUND

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: POUNDING ON THE DOOR FROM THE NURSES OUTSIDE, and Julie i shaking Dylan as hard as she can without hurting him. But despite all this, the injection is having its way.  Dylan sagging before her very eyes.  Eyelids fluttering, words  slurring... DYLAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's mommy?  Where's... Then his head lolls onto his shoulders. CLOSE ON HIS EYE.  CLOSING.  Then opening just a crack,  seeing SOMETHING BIG AND DARK AND AWFUL rising behind Julie.   Something with long, vicious claws at the ends of his  gleaming steel fingers. DYLAN (cont'd) (faint)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julie, behind you! She turns.  There's nothing there for her to see. But DYLAN SEES THE CLAWS RAISE OVER JULIE, then fall onto like the scythe of the Grim Reaper himself. FROM OUR POV, JULIE lets out a scream and is hauled up in mid-are by an invisible but horrible force just as

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door behind bursts open.  The two nurses barge in, th freeze, seeing

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A SCREAMING, WRITHING JULIE lifted into the air by invisi hands, then flung to the floor.  Next moment she's being  dragged bodily up the wall, leaving a scarlet trail of li blood.  Dylan jerks suddenly up into amulatory sleep.   Eyes glazed, face rigid and pale.  And Julie smashes to t floor behind him.  The nurses scream at a terror they cou never in a million years imagine

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: and Dylan runs out of the room and is gone!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heather, as the security guards react to the screams and from the room, gives one look to Dr. Hefner.  The woman  frozen in fear.  She then turns and bolts from the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HEATHER RACES BY CAMERA as a nurse running from Julie's r stops the security guards. NURSE ABBOTT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forget it.  Nothing you can do there.   Call the cops.  Now! The guards tear off in another direction.  Heather races to the testing room and looks inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blood everywhere.  But no Dylan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns to Nurse #2. HEATHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My son.  Did you see my son? NURSE #2 (in shock)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I...thought he was here...I thought... Then Dr. Hefner's there.  Not seeing yet into the room. DR. HEFNER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No way he's going anywhere.  He's been  well sedated. HEATHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He doesn't have to be awake to be on his  feet. DR. HEFNER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? HEATHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He sleepwalks, you idiot!  He's fully  capable of walking out of this hospital. (swallows, realizing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God...He thinks I've gone home... Without another word she turns and runs out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HEATHER'S VOLVO roars down the ramp and onto the street,  narrowly missing a collision, screaming off into the nigh

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heather drives as fast as she can, scans the streets whil she's punching up a number on her carphone.  It rings and picked up by a sleepy JOHN SAXON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John Saxon.  Do you have any idea what  time it is? HEATHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John.  It's Heather.  I need help! JOHN SAXON (instantly alert)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got it.  What's happening? HEATHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dylan's run away from the hospital.  I  don't know whether he's wandering around  or heading for the house.  But I think  Freddy's after him.  I know it sounds  crazy! JOHN SAXON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're right.  That sounds crazy! HEATHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John.  Will you please just look for him  around the hospital?  I'm gonna go right  to the house. (near tears)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will you help me, John?  Please! There's a beat.  Then. JOHN SAXON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm on my way.  You go home, Heather.   That's the smart thing to do.  I'll call  you there! Now Heather is crying. HEATHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, John.  I'll never forget... She doesn't get anything else.  She sees something so  chilling through her windshield, she just slams on the br and stares in disbelief.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EMBANKMENT.  TO THE TINY FIGURE up there in cowboy pajama Doggedly clawing his way up through the weeds and crestin the hill.  There, lit now by the flare of a thousand  headlights, is Dylan, staring across either lanes of high speed traffic.  Trying to see his home!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heather leaps out of the car and screams at the top of he lungs. HEATHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dylannnnnnn!!!!

dialogues.speaker: DYLAN
dialogues.text: on the edge of the freeway.  Traffic roaring by, wind rip through his hair.  Somehow in all this din he still hears mother and turns.

dialogues.speaker: SEEING HER RUNNING ACROSS THE STREET
dialogues.text: starting up the steep embankment after him. HEATHER (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dylan!  Stay right there! But then he looks up and reacts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: the night sky.  A giant bank of clouds, moving, twisting, changing into a huge, DARK FIGURE in a wide-brimmed hat,  peering out from behind the clouds in frightening silhoue It looks down on him with glowing, leering eyes.  And the the huge steel claws poke through the very fabric of the  night, rendering it asunder as the light of the full moon catches in their wicked curves. Without another choice, Dylan turns and runs into traffic Instantly, there's a BLARE OF AIRHORNS and semi-tractor  trailer is screaming down on him.  Momentarily blinded by headlights, Dylan barely manages to dance sideways enough and the truck misses him by inches!  But this puts Dylan  directly in the path of a SPEEDING CAR coming up in the n lane.  He freezes, the car swerves and screams around him close his clothes are ruffled by the wind!

dialogues.speaker: ON HEATHER
dialogues.text: hearing the BRAKES AND HORNS.  She convulses in horror an lets out a scream of her own.  Then redoubles her efforts clawing her way over the fence and up the hill!

dialogues.speaker: WITH DYLAN
dialogues.text: staggering for the median strip, three howling lanes away

dialogues.speaker: WITH HEATHER
dialogues.text: topping the embankment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: seeing in horror her son, missed and missed again by inch unable to cross the last two lanes.

dialogues.speaker: DYLAN
dialogues.text: as a huge CLAWED HAND stabs into FRAME, plucking him up a swinging him with merciless sport, in and out of the path oncoming cars!

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO HEATHER
dialogues.text: about to start after him, then, to her amazement, SEEING

dialogues.speaker: DYLAN
dialogues.text: no claw visible whatsoever, just lifting into the air aga all laws of physics, nearly dashed to oblivion time and t again. HEATHER (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Freddy!  You bastard!  Take me! And she runs straight for him!

dialogues.speaker: A TANKER TRUCK
dialogues.text: slams on all brakes, hews sideways.  Heather sees it comi turns and runs for her life.  But it's coming too fast.   She dives, tucks and looks up just in time to see the who massive tanker sweep right over her head!  Cars are slewi every which way, but she stumbles back up and presses on. Her terror surpassed only by her utter resolve to get to

dialogues.speaker: DYLAN
dialogues.text: the blade of the claw cuts clear through his PJ's.  He dr hard.  He jumps up and darts through a gap in the median  fence.

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: leaps for her life as a station wagon blurs past her with even seeing her.  Then she looks up to see a second car,  brakes smoking and screaming, coming right at her!  She's paralyzed by fear to move, and the car hits her just befo it stops, knocking her flying.  A moment later the freewa her side grinds to a halt. Already people are out of their cars and running to her a But on the other side of the median strip, the brakes are still SCREAMING!

dialogues.speaker: WITH DYLAN
dialogues.text: looking back to his mother's side.  Then seeing dozens an dozens of FREDDYS suddenly peering at him over the brink the median wall.  Dylan turns and runs, and somehow, by  absolute miracle, makes it to the far side, plunging down embankment!

dialogues.speaker: WITH HEATHER
dialogues.text: dazed, but fighting her way up.  She pulls away from the  helping arms and staggers after her son!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heather stumbles and limps down the street, bloodied and  bruised, but moving.  She stops in front of her house. The front door is open.  She runs in

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HEATHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dylan!!! She listens, hears something, then sees the shadow of a m ease out from the dark kitchen!  She gives a scream and  shrinks back.  Then sees it's

dialogues.speaker: JOHN SAXON
dialogues.text: JOHN SAXON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holy... HEATHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's Dylan?!  Have you seen him? Saxon tries to soothe her. JOHN SAXON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Relax, Nancy.  Relax! He points.  Heather, not knowing what the hell's going on with him using Nancy's name, turns and looks:

dialogues.speaker: DYLAN
dialogues.text: toddling out of his room, holding his guard dinosaur, Rex The child's eyes are still glazed, and he's definitely no awake, but he's singing softly... DYLAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One two, Freddy's coming...Freddy's  coming... Heather races over and hugs him.  So hard Saxon's afraid  she'll hurt the kid. JOHN SAXON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What in the world happened? Heather just hugs Dylan, trying not to cry. HEATHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know how Chase really died. JOHN SAXON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you talking about? HEATHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fred Krueger did it. JOHN SAXON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, sure. Heather looks at Dylan. HEATHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You saw him, didn't you, Dylan!? DYLAN (in deep trance)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coming for you... Saxon gently pulls Heather away. JOHN SAXON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, come outside a minute.  I need to  talk to you. He pulls her up and marches her towards the front door. HEATHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dylan! Dylan, sucking his thumb now, has turned to stare back at bedroom, apparently not hearing her. JOHN SAXON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus, what the hell's going on, Nancy? heather looks at him, dazed.  Saxon pulls her outside and closes the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something is different.  Heather registers it subconsciou the moment they're through the door, but she's too focuse Saxon's strange misnomer for her... HEATHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John, why are you calling me Nancy? Saxon looks at her. JOHN SAXON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

He's staring back at her from in front of an UNMARKED POL CAR with its magnetic dome light flashing.  Those of us w a good memory might even realize that it's the identical that LT. THOMPSON drove in NIGHTMARE I.  And even more mi boggling, he's now dressed in the wardrobe of Lt. Thompso from the same film! JOHN SAXON/LT. THOMPSON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Freddy's dead, Nancy.  Now don't lose it  like your mother. Heather steps back, stung.  Saxon/Lt. Thompson instantly  regrets having said that.  Comes back and hugs Heather  fiercely. JOHN SAXON/LT. THOMPSON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you, sweetheart.  Don't ever  forget that. He turns and gets in the car. HEATHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you too, Daddy... Tears spring to her eyes and for some reason she gives a shudder, as we...

dialogues.text: DYLAN'S BED, as something starts to rise from under its  blankets.  Something big and powerful.  Rising to a full  man's height and still coming.  And then the claws are po through, breaking out.  And we SEE FREDDY, a hulking, dar silhouette of pure evil.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON SAXON/LT. THOMPSON AND HEATHER/HEATHER, Saxon  leaning out of the car. JOHN SAXON/LT. THOMPSON

dialogues.text: Now get yourself some rest, Nancy...  please? He starts the engine and siren.  Then the dome lights.  H roars away.  Heather stares after him in shock a moment, realizes that everything is different.  This isn't her fr yard at all.  Even her wardrobe has changed.  She's now  wearing the same pajamas she wore in our opening boiler r nightmare.  She feels the cold chill up her spine.  Turns around and looks at her house.

dialogues.speaker: THE HOUSE ON ELM STREET
dialogues.text: stares back at her.  Its windows barred.  Its front door  swinging open in the wind. Then she hears her child's SCREAM.   HEATHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dylan! She races inside and the iron reinforced door slams shut  behind her!

Then she notices two things: disemboweled remains of Rex flung on the floor near the f of the bed, and then still another pill, on the blanket n the pillows. She picks this pill up.  Then, on impulse, lifts the blan and looks under.  Two more pills, on in the middle, one f down towards the bottom.  She pulls the blanket all the w back.  Nothing but bed, then floor. Then Heather realizes... HEATHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's given me the only way I can join  him. She closes her eyes and takes the pills.  All of them.   Swallows.  Turns back to the bed, lifts the cover again.

dialogues.speaker: THE COVERS
dialogues.text: There's another pill there now, so far down she has to ge under the blanket to reach it.  She tucks the knife in he belt and crawls under.

dialogues.text: Heather picks up the capsule, starts to squiggle back out then, again on impulse, lifts the blanket at the very bot of the bed.

dialogues.text: And this time, instead of the edge of the mattress and fl beyond, only more sheet is revealed.  Going on another fi or six feet.  And sloping downwards.  And down there, nea the place where sheet and blanket come together, is anoth pill.  Heather starts down for it.

dialogues.text: now completely within the softly glowing tent of blanket, pitched downward awkwardly, she picks up the pill and tak it and the other.  And just...has to lift the blanket and check if there's one more. What is revealed is a steep slope of sheet dropping away  sharply into what could be infinity, it goes so far.  Hea draws back, intimidated.  Yawns and starts to crawl back Then hears the VOICE from down there. DYLAN (distant)

dialogues.text: Heather flies out of a stone flume in this wall amid cour water, pitching out into thin air and out of frame!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: UP ANGLE to a toothed rectangle in some ancient ceiling. Above is darkness, out of which falls Heather/Nancy. She plunges down into the deep, fetid water of some  horrendous catch of basin.  She surfaces, gasping and hal drowned, looking around. She finds herself lit in hellish hues by the flames licki through a monumental wall of furnaces behind her.   Galleries of stone and vistas of a city of Night stretch in all directions.  The heavy drizzle of condensed steam everywhere.  And there is a palpable feeling of...Evil HEATHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: D...Dylan? Her only answer is the horrific SOUND OF STEEL NAILS  SCRATCHING ALONG STEEL.  A sound a thousand times worse t fingernails on a chalkboard! She reaches under the red water, coming up with the butch knife.  Then turns and splashes towards the last sound. She searches the vast room, then stops, hearing the  faintest... DYLAN (O.S.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mommy? She races across the chamber towards the wall of flame, a there at its base is DYLAN.  Crouched alone in front of a huge furnace, backlit by the angry flames.  And he's hold something.  A sheaf of papers.  And the whole dimension f quiet as he holds it out to her... Heather starts for him, then warily stops, alert for a tr HEATHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here. She splashes to him.  Drops the knife on a sill of a furn and takes him in her arms.

dialogues.speaker: THE TWO
dialogues.text: a long, tender embrace.  Heather looks at his face.  He s alright.  Then she looks at the papers in his hand. HEATHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What...what is that? DYLAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A story? Heather finds herself seized by the strangest compulsion look, despite where she is.  She opens a page towards the back at random.  And smiles grimly. HEATHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.  It's a story.  A story for a movie. DYLAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Read me some? Heather just shakes her head, incredulous at the eerie  accuracy of the writing... HEATHER (reading)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "At last his mother finds him.  She gives  him a long, happy hug.  And then looks at  the pages.  'Story?' the little boy asks.   'Yes,' says his mother.  'A story of us.'   And the mother takes the book and begins  to read." (Heather looks at him and  laughs' reads more)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "And as she begins to read, from behind  her there comes...There comes..." She stiffens, realizing, twists around and at the same sp second he strikes.  The true FREDDY, huge and dark and  incredibly fast.  Slamming into her and lifting her up in clawed hands.  Snatching away the script and flinging it the fire. FREDDY

dialogues.text: Meet your maker! He lifts his arm to strike, then lets out the most GOD AW

dialogues.text: down there on the deck with the big knife jammed into the back of Freddy's right knee!

dialogues.speaker: FREDDY
dialogues.text: goes down like a fallen Seqouia clawing for the child.   DYLAN springs backwards barely out of reach of the monste Heather leaps onto the monster's back, pulling him off. Dylan is free. HEATHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Run, Dylan! And run he does.  Freddy twists Heather around and flings across the room into a stone pillar.  Heather hits hard a doesn't move.  Freddy turns and SEES

dialogues.speaker: DYLAN
dialogues.text: dodging through an archway and disappearing.

dialogues.speaker: FREDDY
dialogues.text: pulls out the knife and flings it away.  Takes off after like a tiger after a fawn.

dialogues.speaker: DYLAN
dialogues.text: through this lowest level of hell.  Fire and steam and  gushing water the only elements, splashing through to a l staircase, turning to see

dialogues.speaker: DYLAN

dialogues.speaker: A FINAL CHAMBER
dialogues.text: a huge furnace ending the passage.  With one last look ov his shoulder telling him he must do something fast.  Dyla climbs like a little monkey and disappears into the maw o the huge furnace.  This one not fired up but still lit fr within by a huge PILOT FLAME.

dialogues.text: Dylan jumps the flame and lands singed but safe on the fa side of the fire pit, safe for the moment as Freddy slams into the opening of the furnace, reaching for him.  And  though he's too big to get in fast, his claws are inching closer and closer, inches now from the boy's body!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heather drags herself up, half dead, but hearing the SCRE OF DYLAN turning to see Freddy head and shoulders inside distant furnace.  She races back and retrieves the knife.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heather splashes through the ankle deep water, coming fas with blood in her eye!  She reaches the stairs and sudden sinks to her knees in sticky goo, flailing and clawing to pull herself free!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.text: Gonna eat you up... He has Dylan now, pulling him up to his face, opening his mouth wider and wider, unhinging his jaw like some horren snake, when suddenly he CONVULSES and drops Dylan then lets out a WAIL.

dialogues.text: Heather has made it there in time and has the knife burie deep between Freddy's legs, her body blocking sight of  exactly where.  But we get the idea.  She shoves it hard twists.  Freddy HOWLS and fills the world.

Together, HEATHER AND DYLAN SLAM the main furnace door and bolt it. The screams are deafening.  Heather backs away, horrified But Dylan climbs right up on the furnace, reaching for th rusted iron lever just above the door and pulls down hard Instantly there's a DEEP RUMBLE and the furnace fills wit huge GOUT OF FLAME!  The child falls back amid deafening  screams from inside the furnace.  Heather sweeps Dylan up staggers off!

His head blossoms with light and then he's blindingly brilliant, rising,  WHITING OUT THE SCREEN, and his screams turn to terrifyin laughter.   The we...

Heather turns to Dylan and pulls his head against her bre She looks to the clock.  It changes from 6:59AM to 7:00. Then she looks to the floor.
